characters: OF THE FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disjointed CALLIOPE MUSIC as the wheel of fate and fortune goes around until we PULL BACK to reveal: JON ARCHER (30) rising winged Pegasus.  On the adjacent unicorn is his son MATTHEW (5).  Clutching a balloon, Matty waves at his dad.  A happy moment, like so many certain to follow -- until we realize we are watching them THROUGH...

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER'S RIFLE SCOPE
dialogues.text: wait until the child clears his aim -- Archer is the target.  They round the bend and disappear...

dialogues.speaker: MATTHEW
dialogues.text: Loses his grip on the unicorn.  Archer reaches over and pulls him into his lap.  They happily ride together... As the horses sweep back INTO VIEW... exposing Archer... Now we see the sniper.  CASTOR TROY is cool, efficient, aggressive, sexual.  His finger closes around the trigger. BOOM!  A BULLET RIPS into Archer's back.  Bleeding... he drops off his horse... and sinks to the deck of the carousel.  His eyes desperately searching... searching... searching... until he sees -- Matthew lies on his back -- still.  Slowly, Archer reaches out and takes Matthew's hand... and now we see COLOR for the first time... Blood red... as bleeding father touches bleeding son... TILT UP TO the winged Pegasus flying by -- now in full color and UP UP UP TO Matthew's red balloon... floating away. HANDEL'S MESSIAH OVER a SERIES OF SHOTS:

dialogues.speaker: FBI BRIEFING ROOM
dialogues.text: Gazing out the window as dawn breaks over the city below is Jon Archer... older... unshaven... fatigued... his eyes reveal a man in the grip of obsession.

dialogues.speaker: CAROUSEL HORSE
dialogues.text: sweeps by, as if marking time itself...

dialogues.speaker: HOLY PLACE
dialogues.text: Smoky, spiritual... dominated by a gleaming, golden cross.  A priest kneels before it -- deep in prayer.  The glimmering cross comes INTO FOCUS... but it's just a light-reflection... off the casing of a large bomb.  This is no chapel... but an atrium.  Somewhere. And as the "priest" rubs out his cigarette we see it's Castor Troy -- carefully installing this complex device.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CAROUSEL HORSE
dialogues.text: sweeps by...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: pockets his FBI badge, then holsters his gun...

dialogues.speaker: CASTOR
dialogues.text: sets the bomb timer -- then replaces a wall panel in front of it.  Totally hidden.

dialogues.speaker: BRIEFING ROOM
dialogues.text: is on a computer screen.  His criminal dossier scrolls by endlessly:  bombings, assassinations, mercenary kidnappings, terrorism-for-hire... Rookie agent LOOMIS studies the details carefully.  Other agents -- including BUZZ and WANDA scan computer grid- maps, man phones, etc. amid the take-out cartons and coffee cups.  These people are on high alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any follow-up from L.A.P.D. Intelligence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get them on the phone -- now. What about S.I.S. and our airport teams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had everything from psychics to satellites on this.  Even if Castor was here... he must have slipped the net by now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here!  And we're going to keep looking until we find him! A silence descends on the chastised team.  As they go back to work, veteran agent TITO BIONDI takes Archer aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, these people have been working round the clock -- you gotta cut them some slack... Archer considers his best friend's advice -- then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cut them some slack when I cut myself some slack. Archer marches out -- slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor quietly shuts the security door behind him.  An Hispanic voice startles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in perfect Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank goodness, I feel like Icarus in the labyrinth -- where's the men's room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This area is off limits, Padre. (re:  security door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in that room? Realizing the JANITOR is already too suspicious, Castor puts a priestly arm around him -- and leads him down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I have a confession to make, but you aren't gonna like it.  I was planting a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- boom -- (patting his neck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, never mind... The Janitor suddenly twitches, his eyes rolls up in his head.  As he gasps his last -- Castor heaves him down a stairwell.  Now we see the needle-thin custom stiletto in Castor's hand. Castor kicks the Janitor's mop and bucket down the stairs -- making everything look like an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children's church choir -- 200 strong -- sing "Behold the Lamb of God."  Clergy and lay persons listen reverently. "Father" Castor strolls by the singers -- casually heading for the exit.  As he passes the risers, a teenage girl drops her sheet music at his feet. Returning it -- he whispers in her ear -- so close he's practically licking it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never enjoyed 'The Messiah.' But your voice makes even a hack like Handel seem like a genius. He pats her behind and leaves.  Although a little shaken, she's also drawn by Castor's sexual magnetism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The marquee proclaims:  INTERNATIONAL CHURCH CHOIRS 18th- 21st:  AMERICAN BAR ASSOCIATION. Castor exits -- politely holding the door for a beat cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office is a monument to obsession:  photographs, clues, newsclips, totems of Castor Troy surround a pacing Archer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't have time to get a warrant from some hung-over judge. Just give me the go-ahead, Victor, and I promise -- as soon as this is over -- you can brand my butt with the Fourth Amendment. The instant Archer hangs up -- the INTERCOM BUZZES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, your wife's on line one... S.I.S. on two...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to hang on -- As Archer punches up line two -- Tito bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jet was chartered at Anderson Airfield.  Guess who just showed up to pay for it?  Pollux Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scramble the Reaction Team -- we're moving out.  And get one of our people on that plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's still no sign of Castor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where one brother goes, the other's sure to follow... They rush our... the hold button on line 1 still blinking.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A sleek Cadillac pulls in... stopping next to a Land Rover. LARS MUELLER -- a muscular, crystal-eyed jar-head -- gets out of the Caddy.  An instant later -- LUNT MUELLER -- emerges from the Rover.  They are identical twins. The men scan the airport carefully, then open the rear doors of their respective vehicles.  Castor emerges from the Caddy -- Armani clad. Exiting the Rover is Castor's younger brother POLLUX TROY -- skittish, brilliant, paranoid -- a human hummingbird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're 26 minutes late.  The casing didn't fit -- right?  I knew that cheap-shit Dietrich would rip us off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgot to turn the damn thing on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding, right? (to the twins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's kidding... (grabs Castor by throat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... are you fucking kidding!? Castor hugs Pollux lovingly.  Pollux squirms like a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bro -- everything went fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate when you call me bro. Pollux heads for the jet.  Castor hands Lunt a wad of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for babysitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll contact you when we get the rest of the money. (turns to leave)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, and stat away from downtown. The inversion layer's going to be pretty thick around the 18th. The twins nod... then take off.  Castor heads for the jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor hustles in -- exhorting the PILOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, let's go! As the JET TURBINES start to WHINE, Castor sinks into his seat.  A very sexy FLIGHT ATTENDANT appears and hands him a Scotch.  He downs it, looking her over salaciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, yes... (pulls her into lap)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way to fly. She smiles, not minding, until the jet suddenly slows its taxi down the runway.

dialogues.speaker: COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Castor yanks open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: AT END OF RUNWAY
dialogues.text: A squat car creeps INTO VIEW -- blocking the runway.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel is Jon Archer.  Beside him is Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Archer. (gun to Pilot's head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, dammit! Suddenly the gun is BLASTED from Castor's hand.  he turns around to see... the Flight Attendant behind them -- holding a smoking pistol.  This is Agent WINTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: F.B.I.!  Throttle down, captain! But Castor elbows the throttle up.  The jet lurches forward, throwing Winters off balance.  Pollux tackles her as the jet picks up speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer slams the vehicle into gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not playing chicken with two tons of aluminum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! Tito obeys as Archer peels out.  The HUMMER ROARS at the jet. The jet picks up speed, trying to get aloft. The humvee is aimed right at it... Archer's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: COLLISION COURSE
dialogues.text: as two hunks of metal bear down.  The machines are seconds apart when -- Archer looks up to see... Winters' face pressed up against the cockpit window, Castor holding a gun to her head. Archer cuts the wheel -- just avoiding the jet.  The Hummer skids to a stop as Federal back-up arrives -- but  too late.  Archer watches an FBI chopper -- landing in a  swirl of dust. As the jet picks up speed... the hatch opens.  Castor blasts Winters in the side and tosses her onto the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Castor smiles at Pollux, sensing freedom, until... KA-CHUNK:  Something POUNDS the jet -- from above. Castor leans out the hatch and sees... The chopper on top of them -- Archer at the controls. Eye-contact -- years of hatred pass between these men. Castor BLASTS at him from the open hatch. The chopper's left windscreen spiderwebs.  Archer jerks and weaves -- dodging the BULLETS.  The chopper pulls away. The jet finally lifts off... when... The chopper settles on the jet -- slamming at its tail.

dialogues.speaker: TARMAC
dialogues.text: Tito reacts to this madness -- as the chopper plays a  deadly game of leap-frog with the jet. The end of the runway is coming up fast. Archer crushes the jet's horizontal elevator flap.

dialogues.speaker: JET PILOT
dialogues.text: can't budge the jet's jammed yoke.  Thwarted, he powers back the throttle.  Thrust reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horizontal elevator's smashed! We can't lift off!

dialogues.speaker: CASTOR
dialogues.text: SHOOTS the Pilot -- then takes the controls.  He struggles to maneuver the jet.  Suddenly... A biplane descends right at them -- about to land.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: pulls up just as the JET swerves radically to avoid the biplane and SLAMS into the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: JET
dialogues.text: plows through the GLASS DOOR, the NOSE-WHEEL SNAPS off. The PLANE SKIDS right into the hangar -- finally stopping at the wings.

dialogues.speaker: FBI CHOPPER
dialogues.text: lands.  Archer steps out calmly -- like a cop about to  write a traffic ticket.  He hurries to join more FBI  agents rushing into the hangar ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jet hatch pops open -- Castor leaps from it, FIRING. Two FBI agents drop -- riddled. Pollux appears at the hatch -- an FBI sharpshooter FIRES, grazing Pollux's shoulder.  Staggered, Pollux falls -- Castor catches him before he hits the floor -- simultaneously BLASTING the sharpshooter. Castor drags Pollux back into the smoke-filled hangar. Archer arrives and quickly checks the dead agents, his anger building.  He signals Tito and the others to spread out.

dialogues.speaker: DEEP IN HANGAR
dialogues.text: A maze of airplane debris and heavy machinery.  Led by Archer, the FBI agents pick their way through it. ROOKIE LOOMIS snaps alert -- did he see something? Advancing carefully, he comes up on... Castor -- staunching Pollux's shoulder wound.  Pollux sees the agent -- and FIRES. Loomis hits the floor -- his bleeding ear is shredded. Suddenly a forklift charges down on Castor and Pollux. Tito is at the wheel.  Castor FIRES -- forcing Tito to dive off.  The forklift careens on -- driving apart the brothers. The forklift upends a stack of heavy crates -- pinning Pollux.  Castor tries to free his trapped brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it -- Go!  Go! He slaps his Glock into Pollux's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever they put you, I'll find a way to get you out... Pollux starts FIRING -- covering Castor as he runs through a tunnel which leads to an adjoining hangar. Suddenly Wanda presses her machine-pistol into Pollux's head.  As Pollux raises his gun -- Tito grabs his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not unless you want that 200 I.Q. splattered all over the floor. (as Archer approaches)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him now, Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you always say.  Seal it off.  I'm going in. Archer moves away from the group and enters the tunnel. MUSIC as Archer and Castor begin their cat-and-mouse dance. Sensing Archer, Castor pauses by an old landing gear.  He draws a fresh pistol from his ankle holster and moves on. Archer pauses at the landing gear... his own stealthy movements mirroring Castor's. Castor waits behind a stack of steel drums... his gaze trying to penetrate the darkness... He SNAPS his fingers. The sound ECHOES as he tries to draw Archer in. Archer reacts to the sound and SNAPS back -- answering the challenge.  As the deadly beat between them continues -- BLAM BLAM BLAM!  Archer spins away just as Castor OPENS FIRE from the gloom... one step ahead. INTERCUT as necessary:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, I'm getting a little annoyed by your obsessive need to spoil my fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how much will your 'fun' net you this time? BOOM BOOM BOOM!  Half-blind SHOTS send Castor spinning. A moment later, Archer pursues... SNAP!  He fits a new CLIP into his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it to you?  I declare it. Here I am, back in the States for less than a week --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under arrest.  Incredibly, you still have the right to remain silent --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something going down on the eighteenth... it's gonna be worse than anything God ever dumped on the Pharaoh.  I'll give it up -- but my brother and I have to walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No discussion -- no deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do with me locked up?  You'll drive your wife and kid nuts!  I bet your daughter is just about ripe by now.  What's her name, Janie? Enraged, Archer steps boldly forward -- trying to draw his enemy out.  Silence -- then Archer senses... Castor is behind him.  He FIRES -- Archer dives away. The BARRAGE CONTINUES -- driving Archer back between two huge turbine engines.  As Archer reloads, he stares at the control panel switches. Castor moves in for the kill when he hears a final SNAP- SNAP.  Except it isn't a finger snap... it's two switches. VRRRROOOM!  The TWIN ENGINES ROAR on!  Unable to fight the churning tornado-force wind... Castor's blasted across the hangar... slamming hard into the far wall. The ENGINES STOP and Archer emerges -- joined by Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me he didn't get away again... Then Tito follows Archer's gaze to Castor's lifeless body.  Still as death -- somehow his mocking smile survives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heavily-manacled, an extremely agitated Pollux is herded into a SWAT van by Buzz and Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my brother?!  I want to see my brother! The van takes off -- passing an imposing older man,  flanked by two bodyguards.  Bullying through the media, Assistant FBI Director VICTOR LAZARRO scans the devastation. Approaching Archer, he watches as Castor's body is loaded on the ambulance.  A sheet covers Castor's lifeless face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The oversight committee would've roasted us for this one -- thank God it paid off.  Damn fine work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real fine, Victor.  Especially the casualties. Archer contemplates the slain agents -- their three bodies laid out in a row -- waiting to be zip-locked. Lazarro reacts grimly as a reporter snaps a photo of the bodies. Instinctively, the two men close ranks.  Archer grabs the Nikon, ejects the film, then shoves the camera back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Classified information.  No photographs. Lazarro puts a caring arm around Archer's shoulder and leads him away from the media... and the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Jon? (off Archer's nod)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go home.  Tell Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A renovated Craftsman.  Sipping a carton of milk, Archer pulls into the driveway.  He sits, gathering his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer enters and sees his wife EVE.  Handsome, intelligent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... What's wrong? She nods toward the KITCHEN.  JAMIE is there -- a sullen  and hard fifteen-year-old.  There are cigarette cartons on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She complimented for her 'F' in history with an 'A' in shoplifting... Archer marches into the kitchen -- noting the crate of Marlboros.  Jamie matter-of-factly pours herself coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice stunt, Jamie.  You break the law and I'm expected to ignore it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- it's all about you.  Don't even ask me what happened. Archer looks to Eve for help.  Eve shakes her head -- nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you'd ever fucking believe me! She bolts.  In anticipation, Eve calmly opens the door as Jamie rushes out, then closes it behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you tried.  You failed miserably, but you tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't she even talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe because you taught her never to speak to strangers. (immediately regrets it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... that wasn't fair. Eve kisses his cheek -- then gathers up her doctor gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got patients waiting.  Try again, Jon.  She hates you -- but she needs you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve... Something in Archer's expression makes her stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon -- what is it? But he's too overcome.  He starts to speak -- but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it -- him?  It's... it's over? Emotions avalanche across his face until he finally looks up.  Eve pulls him close -- a sheltering embrace for them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make everything up to you and Jamie.  I'll put in for a desk job.  We'll go away, get counseling -- anything you want. This time, I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freshly dressed, Archer heads down the hall.  He pauses  at the door to Jamie's room when he sees -- Jamie. Fully clothed, she's fast asleep on her bed cluttered with clothes and assorted girl-stuff.  Her face peaceful. Archer looks around her room... sees the stuffed animals  collecting dust... replaced by makeup, jewelry, beefcake Calvin Klein ads and band posters, etc. Archer's startled to see a lacey bustier... his little  girl is growing up fast.  And he's missing it. He pulls the blanket up over her and quietly slips out. The instant he leaves, Jamie kicks the blankets off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dominated by the FBI seal.  Archer steps to the check point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Print, please. Archer presses his thumb to a scan-pad -- and is cleared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Efficient as a beehive -- agents, cryptologists, support  staff buzz at their routines.  Archer strides through --  drawing congratulatory nods and "thumbs up" signs...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE HIS OFFICE
dialogues.text: Archer's team is there.  Applauding.  Proud.  Uneasy with plaudits, he disperses the disappointed agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much appreciated.  Now let's get back to work, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Buzz)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that stick ever gonna fall out of his ass? Archer's well-built secretary -- KIM BREWSTER -- hands him his messages.  She's holding a bottle of Dom Perignon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The C.I.A. sent this over.  What should I do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send it back and tell them to stop wasting the taxpayers' money. Anything else, Miss Brewster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. He enters his office.  Kimberly sighs and turns to Wanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years -- and he still calls me 'Miss Brewster.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting at his computer -- Archer scrolls through Castor's file.  He grimly contemplates face-after-face of Troy's victims -- finally pausing on a photo of his son Matthew. Burying his feeling, he types "CASE CLOSED" over Castor's image.  Archer starts to press "enter" when Tito comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Loomis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs some surgery, but he's going to be okay.  That's the good news...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Brodie and Miller from Special Ops need to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time for those cloak and dagger guys. Big NED BRODIE and athletic female HOLLIS MILLER stroll in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better make time, Jon. (hefts a disc)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We found this in the jet wreckage -- among Pollux Troy's effects... Archer accedes as Miller pops in the disk.  The computer screen displays a CAD schematic of the bomb.  Archer studies it carefully -- unease growing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porcelain casing... Thermal cloak... Undetectable payload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Powerful enough to flatten ten city blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Worse than anything God ever dumped on the Pharaohs.' (to Tito)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Pollux Troy.  Now.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION FOOTAGE
dialogues.text: Wired to a complex machine -- Pollux seems to have his frustrated interrogators on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer, Lazarro, Tito, Brodie, Miller and other FBI officials watch the monitor.  Pollux remains implacable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bomb was just a crossword puzzle to me... a mental exercise. I never built it... Lazarro shuts down the monitor... turns to Archer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hooked up to a full-spectrum polygraph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pollux is a manipulative psychopath.  He can control his heartbeat, his sweat glands, his blood pressure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, I trust your instincts, I always have.  But D.C. wants more evidence.  And frankly, so do I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get all the evidence you need when ten thousand people die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll get a team right on it.  But we can't evacuate the city on what amounts to a hunch. Archer looks at the gathered brass.  He knows it's  hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bomb has been built, it's out there somewhere and it's going to detonate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Words etched in the granite wall read: IN HONOR OF THOSE MEMBERS

dialogues.speaker: OF THE FEDERAL BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION
dialogues.text: WHO SACRIFICED THEIR LIVES IN THE LINE OF DUTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer watches as a workman engraves the last of the three new stars among so many others -- each one honoring the dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Castor give any clue where the bomb might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one person knows -- his brother Pollux.  And he'll keep his mouth shut until it blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could plant an agent in his cell -- get him to spill the location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pollux is way too paranoid.  The only person he'd talk to about that bomb is Castor himself.  And dead men can't talk. Brodie and Miller exchange a knowing look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There might be a way around that...

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: Tubes and hoses are plugged into every orifice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer stares at the body... he can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you keeping him alive? (gets no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as he's breathing, he's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, he's a turnip. Miller grinds out her cigarette on Castor's leg.  Of course, Castor just lies there like a vegetable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can arrange for you to enter Erewhon Prison -- as Castor Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Archer turns as DR. MALCOLM HOAG (50s) enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd better answer that question. (offers hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Malcolm Hoag.  I run the Physiological Camouflage Unit for Special Ops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't know what he can do. Physical augmentation; enhancement surgery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He can disguise a compromised agent or alter the likeness -- even the voice -- of a government witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me show you how it's done. (leading him out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'll recognize our patient...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loomis lies still as a surgeon carefully scrapes away charred flesh around his burned ear.  The doctor turns to a --

dialogues.speaker: STEREO-LITHOGRAPHIC MACHINE
dialogues.text: Laser-beams attack an organic soup with incredible precision.  The light forces a chemical reaction -- and  out of the soup -- an ear begins to form.  It rises from  the liquid, now fully-formed.  The surgeon takes the ear  and fits it in place on Loomis's head.  He starts  suturing.

dialogues.speaker: OBSERVATION BOOTH
dialogues.text: Archer, Hoag, Brodie and Miller watch the operation -- video-enhanced by the two huge screens on the far walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With our new generation of anti- inflammatories, healing is accelerated from weeks to days. By his next paycheck, he won't even remember which ear he lost. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your situation, however, would be a little less permanent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and a lot more classified. Hoag holds up a face-sized organic shell made up of yellow cartilage pieces and tendons, etc.  Archer pulls it over his face -- like a gauze mask.  A "tendon" falls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll fool Pollux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is a state-of-the-art morpho- genetic template.  The inside can be built to match the exact shape of your skull; the outside -- exactly like Castor's.  Then we fit his face right on top --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and you become him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about removing the guy's face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrowing, Jon.  The procedure's completely reversible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One way or the other -- the mission ends on the eighteenth. Archer turns the shell over and over and over in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Castor better than anyone.  You've lived and breathed him for years -- hell, you even look a little like him. Archer shoves the template back at Hoag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find yourself another lab-rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't do this -- Castor will beat us again.  He'll beat you again... Archer pushes his way past them -- and marches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that went very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust us, Doc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he'll jerk around.  Then he'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer enters... sizes up DIETRICH HASSLER.  His stylish garb doesn't completely hide his criminal roots.  Archer sits down calmly.  He looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a hurry, Dietrich.  So you've only got ten seconds to go through your usual litany of lies, empty threats, and moronic denials.  Then I'm coming over there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're in such a fucking hurry -- why are you wasting your time with me?  I'm just an art dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dealer, all right: technical secrets, munitions... explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never proven any of that. And when my bitchy, never-been- laid femi-nazi lawyer gets here, she's going to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up. Archer topples the wooden table and tears a leg from the top.  Brandishing it -- he stalks the startled thug.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY JUST OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Lazarro blanches as an obsessed Archer repeatedly slams the table leg against the wall -- above Dietrich's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only ticking bomb I see is inside his head.  He's getting worse, Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, sir.  It's all an act... But as Lazarro leaves -- we see Tito's worried, too.

dialogues.speaker: BACK INSIDE BOOTH
dialogues.text: Archer has a terrified Dietrich backed into the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Okay!  Castor called me but I blew him off... I swear I never saw him.  And I don't know anything about any bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer emerges... eyes blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him go, but I want him watched... Who's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just Dietrich's sister... In another booth, a careworn but striking woman sits with a little boy on her lap.  She gently helps him Crayola a book.  This is SASHA HASSLER (30) and her son ADAM (5).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer hovers over Sasha -- her maternal warmth replaced by an icy hatred.  Tito and the child are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw Castor Troy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?  He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm clean.  I teach kids now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha -- you are a felon, on probation for harboring Castor Troy.  So it's in your best interest to cooperate. (as she's silent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like your son put in a foster home? Sasha's eyes flash, her body coils -- but she keeps control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm sure you'd love it -- you sick bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unmoved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was the last time you saw Castor Troy? She stares at him with equal amounts of pity and hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen him for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer watches as Adam leaves Dietrich and jumps into  Sasha's arms.  She hugs him protectively.  Adam sees Archer watching them -- and smiles.  Archer doesn't smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer slowly circles Castor's muscular, hairy, tattooed body.  Although on life support -- his signature smirk remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Lazarro?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way -- the red tape alone would take a month.  This is a black-bag operation -- completely off the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need him, Tito can help you prepare.  But you know the drill: You can't tell anyone -- not the Director, not your wife... nobody. Archer's face shows he doesn't like it -- then he nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer slowly gets out of his car.  Trudging toward the front door, he picks up a basketball and takes a shot. His form is terrible -- he misses by a mile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer passes Jamie's room.  Loud MUSIC POUNDS from  within.  He pauses to knock, thinks again, then heads down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is in bed.  Archer comes in quietly and sits beside  her -- studying her peaceful, sleeping face.  She stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was dreaming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure... you were flying this weird old stunt plane... doing flips... walking on the wings... I was watching from the ground -- when you fell.  You had a parachute, but you wouldn't open it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you catch me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... (nuzzles him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe because you've never needed my help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you made that up, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Maybe I did... (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... maybe I didn't... They kiss affectionately.  Passion building, Eve runs her hands over his body -- until her fingers touch a round scar on his chest.  Archer freezes -- mid-caress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all these years, I still can't get it out of my head -- an inch to the left, Matty would still be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you wouldn't be. No response.  The pain hidden in his silence chills Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things will get better now that you're home.  Everything will be better -- now that... that man is finally out of our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve... He starts to say the words.  He wants, needs to share the truth with her.  But he can't.  Instead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... If I had to do something to find some closure... I should do it, shouldn't I?... No matter how crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God -- you're going on assignment again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One last time.  And while I'm gone, I want you and Jamie to go to your mother's.  It's important...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd be here!  You promised!  What could be more important than that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you... except only I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to tell you it's okay to leave?  Okay, go on!  Go! Fury erupting, Eve pushes Archer out of the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer enters a child's room -- neat and tidy, like a  museum exhibit.  A starfield of glow-letters twinkles faintly. He lies down on the bed and toys with his wedding band -- staring up at the words the stars form... "MATTHEW."

dialogues.speaker: LIGHTS
dialogues.text: The blinking LED of the bomb timer continues to count down.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Tito drives into the Hoag compound. Archer's beside him, juggling Castor's dossier: documents, photos, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, this is goddam insane.  You can't do it. Archer says nothing... it's too late for debate.  Tito parks.  The men get out and head for the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't got a chance in hell of fooling Pollux.  Castor drinks, smokes and walks around with a 24- hour hard-on.  He's nothing like you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry... If Hoag can do half what he claims, I'll get Pollux to talk. Archer reaches for the door -- Tito stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple, Jon... Becoming another person -- especially him -- nobody can come all the way back from that... not even you. Archer considers his friend's words... He toys with, then removes, his wedding bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep this for me. As Tito takes the ring -- a caring, but concerned look passes between the two friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two huge video screens are dominated by the CG-images of Archer and Castor.  As Hoag briefs the team, the CG- images glow to reflect the physical characteristic Hoag refers to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's walk through it, Jon.  Your blood types are different, but we can't do anything about that. Otherwise, nature is cooperating nicely.  The height difference is negligible -- within 1/2 an inch. Eye color -- almost a perfect match.  Penis size, flaccid, essentially the same -- Substantial. From the observation booth above -- Miller (flanked by Tito and Brodie) raises his eyebrow. On the video screens, the images morph to signify the physical augmentations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hairline will be adjusted with laser-shears... micro-plugs for the body hair... the teeth will be bonded to match Castor's... Hoag eyes Castor's inert, tight body -- then turns to Archer -- prodding his love handles like a livestock inspector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about an abdominoplasty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abdomino -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tummy tuck.  On the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INTERCUT huge video screen enlargements of Archer and Castor's body parts as necessary): Globules of adipose tissue are siphoned off Archer's  obliques.  At the same time... Hoag recreates the "Great Sphinx" tattoo on Archer's thigh.  We PUSH IN ON his leg, then PULL BACK to reveal... Archer and Tito.  The CLOSE UP on his leg becomes a FULL SHOT as he walks across the rooftop -- like himself. Tito demonstrated the proper "Castor gait": dangerously casual, like a panther. Hoag reproduces Castor's fingerprints... then layers them over Archer's fingers. Archer practices Castor's icy, killer glare.  Tito hands him a lit cigarette.  Archer brings the cigarette to his lips -- then coughs harshly.  But he keeps trying. Castor smiles... then smirks and laughs.  PULL BACK to reveal Archer studying surveillance footage of Castor on a monitor-screen -- mimicking him. Archer fusses with his new hair, trying to cover the thin spots.  Giving  up, he zips up his sweatshirt -- getting the zipper caught in his new chest hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tito tosses a pistol.  Archer catches it with his right hand.  But to Archer's surprise, Tito frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice catch.  But you used the wrong hand. He takes the pistol away -- and slaps it in Archer's left hand.  Then Tito shoves him -- challengingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot me. (as Archer doesn't move)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot me! Tito pulls the gun against his own forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be Castor Troy?  If you hesitate for a breath, you're finished!  Now -- shoot me!  Kill me! Archer holds the gun unsteadily.  Tito is disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do it... because Castor is tougher than you... BOOM!  The GUN goes off -- the slug tears past Tito's head.  Shocked, he touches his left ear, making sure it's still there. Then Tito looks at Archer -- and sees the determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear and calm.  God's night.  Someone's God anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoag leads Archer to a full-length mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if I missed anything before I get my hands really dirty. Archer removes the robe.  He's amazed to see: His own head on Castor's body:  a flat stomach, hairy chest, tattoos, thinning hair, etc.  Hoag touches Archer's scar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize this has to be removed. (as Archer slowly nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then here we go, Commander. Through the Looking Glass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unconscious, Archer is wheeled into the surgical bay,  Castor beside him.  Hoag turns to the video technician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make sure you get everything -- I'll need to study the tape before the reverse surgery. Hoag lowers an aerated Plexiglas mask over Archer's face. Interwoven with integrated laser circuitry -- this Derma- Induction-Device (D.I.D.) attaches via suction. Hoag sights through the optical memory, squeezes the trigger.  A cobalt beam cuts around the face -- cleanly slicing it.  Then Hoag lifts Archer's face -- off of his skull. Brodie and Miller watch from above.  Tito stumbles into the nearby bathroom to throw up. Hoag inspects Archer's face, then turns to his nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vault it. Hoag turns to perform the same procedure on Castor. Castor's consistent EEG reading suddenly spikes radically -- for a moment, it almost seems to stabilize. Hoag glances over -- too late -- the spikes have  disappeared. But the CAMERA CLOSES IN ON Castor's ear -- and we sense that, somehow, his auditory nerves might be functioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A head swathed in gauze.  The bandages start to fall  away. Tito, Miller and Brodie wait as Hoag removes the gauze. The patient looks into a mirror. Jon Archer has become Castor Troy. he touches his new face.  Archer stares... the cold reality chilling his blood. Archer buckles -- unprepared emotionally for what he's done to himself.  For a moment, he seems to teeter on madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon -- are you all right? Archer can't respond... he's somewhere the others can't comprehend.  Finally he emerges... shaken, but in control. TITO enters.  Instinctively, he grabs for his holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... I'm okay. (realizes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But my voice... I still sound like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I implanted a micro-chip onto your larynx. Hoag SWITCHES ON an AUDIO TAPE.  Archer repeats Castor's words as Hoag adjusts the chip with a wavelength box.

dialogues.speaker: CASTOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, I've got a               Okay, I've got a confession to make, but        confession to make, but you aren't gonna like          you aren't gonna like it... (etc.)                   it... (etc.) After a few repetitions, Archer's voice matches perfectly. Archer yawns, squints and furrows his brow -- testing  every muscle.  He stares into the mirror -- into the eyes of his most hated enemy -- now his eyes.  Archer slowly  turns to... Castor.  Motionless, swathed, dead to the world -- but something about Castor's smile -- that mocking smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're down to 72 hours.  Let's call Lazarro.  Castor Troy just came out of his coma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Armed agents take their positions around a helipad.  A  jet-black helicopter drops from the sky like an angry  wasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lazarro watches -- Tito escorts out a heavily-manacled "Castor."  Two armed agents leap from the chopper and  take charge of "Castor."  He follows them pliantly, until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this hard-case -- he'll bite your nuts off if he gets the chance! Archer gets the message.  He starts to resist the agents  and must be muscled into the chopper.  He's manacled  down. Eye contact between Archer and Tito -- both aware of this very real point of departure.  The CHOPPER DOOR SLAMS SHUT.  It lifts off like a twister and SCREAMS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The watching team breaks up, wanders back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a week for Archer to go on a training op.  Maybe we should try to contact him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.  He's knee-deep in Georgia swamp by now. They pass Brodie and Miller, who watch the chopper  disappear over the horizon.  So far so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent re-checks Archer's chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget -- I ordered a kosher meal... The agent smashes his elbow into Archer's gut.  The  second agent presses an INJECTOR against Archer's leg. PSSSST.  Archer spasms against the drug -- then sags unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer wakes up as a torrent of delousing spray hits him. A guard holds a water cannon on the newest inmate. Archer lies gasping on the steel floor, protecting his face.  The spray stops -- when head guard "RED" WALTON enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are now an Erewhon inmate -- a citizen of nowhere.  Human rights zealots, the Geneva convention and the P.C. police have no authority here.  You have no right... (slaps on latex gloves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I say your ass belongs to me -- I mean it.  Bend over. Archer's face reflects the degradation as he bends over and exposes all to the cavity-searching Guard. Satisfied, Walton lets Archer dress.  Another guard places a pair of odd-looking steel boots before Archer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step into them. Archer inspects the lock-down boots.  Hinged steel collars hook over the shoe and encase the ankle.  The soles are gridded steel with magnetic inserts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sniff 'em, you perv.  Just step into them. Archer obeys.  A guard squats down and locks the steel collars over Archer's shoes.  He tries to move -- but can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're too tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's a noose.  Now keep your mouth shut. Walton JOLTS Archer with his HIGH-VOLTAGE SHOCK-STICK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prison's one big magnetic field.  The boots'll tell us where you are -- every second of the day. (into comm-link)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 201 to Population. Walton presses his thumb into a standard FBI scan-pad. It forms a print -- positively identifying the guard. The heavy blast-door automatically opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got fifty bucks says you're dead by dinner.  Don't disappoint me. Walton prods Archer toward the door.  To Archer's surprise -- he can now move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inmates eat.  Silence descends as Archer enters -- intensifying the constant HUMMING of the MAGNETIC FIELD. Huge Dubov does a slow burn on seeing "Castor." Scanning the room for Pollux -- Archer takes a seat next to a LITTLE, GOATEED MAN with a French accent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Castor -- remember me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fabrice Voisine... sure, I -- (catches himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I believe Jon Archer busted you for poisoning five members of the the Canadian parliament?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those scumbags should never have voted against the Quebecois. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard you got wasted. Archer sees the other inmates sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look wasted -- asshole? Voisine shakes his head "no" -- then his eyes widen as... WHAM.  Dubov leaps onto Archer and starts pummeling him. They slide across the table -- spilling everyone's lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into comm-unit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Central.  I have a disturbance in population.  Go to lock down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into comm-unit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold that lock down. Walton watches as Dubov throws Archer across the room. Archer staggers to his feet -- and sees the encircling inmates and guards looking at him -- unimpressed. Especially his "brother" Pollux -- who watches uncertainly. Dubov attacks again -- but Archer is ready.  He grabs Dubov's fist -- just before it hits his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never -- in -- the -- face. Holding Dubov's fist firmly, Archer kicks Dubov repeatedly in the groin.  Metal boot meeting soft flesh. Dubov staggers back -- hurt.  Archer moves in for the kill, savoring it. Walton looks skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock 'em down.

dialogues.speaker: UP ABOVE
dialogues.text: The prison's nerve center -- with video-feeds and monitors designed to keep problems and privacy to a minimum. The two deputies react to Walton's call.  Identifying Archer and Dubov's signature-blips -- they throw the appropriate switches and... ZAP!  The magnetic boots lock both inmates to the floor. Dubov flails hopelessly -- but Archer's just out of  reach. Crack!  Walton punches Archer in the diaphragm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  He started it! Walton smashes Archer harder -- he hits the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get out of here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to have you fired. His statement is so ludicrous, Walton laughs.  Everyone  does.  From the inmates' reactions, Archer knows he's  been accepted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dubov)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's two strikes, Dubov.  One more and you know where you're going. (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to your 'suites' -- or no dinner. As Archer drops into the line of cons -- he spots Pollux waiting for him.  Girding himself for this first  encounter -- he's got a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, bro...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Pollux?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's Pollux, what the fuck's wrong with you? Archer stares -- feigning confusion until Walton prods  him forward.  Pollux watches his "brother" go -- very  concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer lies on his cot -- staring at the ceiling.   Isolated, lonely, he realizes how easy it would be to go  insane here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An insanely starry night.  Van Gogh's night.  The night  he cut off his ear, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor's body lies inert.  His life-support MACHINES BLIPPING away.  Until the EEG spikes.  Once -- twice --  three times.  Brain wave activity increases -- and  stabilizes. Castor's fingers twitch.  Then his fist clenches -- hard. Castor's head is swathed in gauze.  But his eyes pop  open. Reflexively, Castor wrenches from the bed -- tearing out  the tubes and wires that tether him to life support.  He  goes down -- in agony -- groaning. He struggles to his feet -- staggering through the lab -- until he catches the reflection of his bandaged face in the window.  He quickly unwraps the gauze. The discarded bandages fall at his feet... we don't see what CASTOR sees -- but we hear him MOAN... then CHOKE... then SCREAM -- the only moment Castor ever loses his cool. Finally composing himself -- Castor's hand grips the phone and he dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lars... okay, Lunt, then. (rifling desk documents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something really fucked-up happened... I'm in trouble... so listen very carefully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RANGE ROVER SCREECHES up.  At gunpoint, Lars and Lunt  manhandle Hoag into the lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lars and Lunt hustle Hoag in.  The lab is on.  The  screens run -- scrolling through the video log of  Archer's surgery. Hoag sees his terrified assistants -- bound with duct tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this about?  What do you want? Lars shoves Hoag into a towering figure... we ZOOM IN ON Hoag's glasses.  And THROUGH the REFLECTION we see...

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITHOUT FACE
dialogues.text: Hoag reacts in horror at the raw muscle, cartilage and bone.  The man lifts a cigarette to his lips... then  exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge wall-screen plays gentle nature scenes.  Below -- the inmates engage in their exercise hour. Voisine stares at the screen -- while Pollux carefully  watches his "brother" play basketball.  Archer tosses up  an air-ball to the jeers of other inmates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize, of course, that magnetic humming is designed to drive us insane.  If we all don't get brain tumors first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that same cloying Bambi tape -- over and over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like they're begging us to riot.  Where the fuck are we, anyway? (the game ends)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go... Pollux trots over to Archer -- passes him his cigarette. He studies Archer as he takes a drag -- and nearly gags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'm worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your jumpshot has no arc.  You used to swagger... now you swish. You're gumming that butt like a Catholic school girl. (notices)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why do you keep picking at your finger? Pollux has caught Archer reflexively tugging at his phantom wedding ring.  Archer immediately stops.  He takes a drag and holds it -- then exhales right in Pollux's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in a coma... Pollux sticks his finger under Archer's eye and pulls  down like a vet examining a sick dog.  Archer pushes him  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My reflexes, my senses, my memory... everything's jumbled.  I can't even tell you why Dubov jumped me yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Pollinated his wife the day he was arrested.  How could forget that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've forgotten plenty.  Look around -- we've screwed over half the freaks in here.  What's gonna happen to us if they think I've lost it? Pollux contemplates the other inmates -- circling, sizing up the brothers like hungry sharks.  Instinctively, Pollux moves closer to Archer for protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to play big brother for once -- till I can fill in a few blanks.  Think you can handle that? Pollux nods grimly -- then Archer pulls up his sleeve, exposing the pyramid tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I got this on my tenth birthday.  I just can't remember why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man -- that was the worst day of our lives! Archer feigns a "struggle" with his memory.  He lights a new butt with the old -- chain-style... then "remembers."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God -- Mom O-D'd at County General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retching and convulsing while those bastards didn't even try to save her sorry ass.  You gave her mouth to mouth -- man -- even then you had some constitution. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what you swore to me at the funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh -- to kill the doctors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After that.  You promised you'd always take care of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I bet I kept that promise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one you've never broken. Pollux curls into Archer -- in need of comfort.  Archer puts an affectionate arm around Pollux -- springing the trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw the past.  We've got the future to look forward to. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit... five million bucks... now those Red Militia crackpots get to keep it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the worst part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's worse than losing five million bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being stuck in this rat-hole when it blows.  What you built was a work of art.  It belongs in the Smithsonian. Pollux beams with pride -- Archer hangs on every word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- well... the L.A. Convention Center will have to do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Pollux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Thanks'?  I guess they really did fuck you up. Then Archer smiles -- like Jon Archer.  Without knowing exactly why -- a wave of ill-ease overtakes Pollux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer paces impatiently... as the door rolls open. Walton is looking at him with cool respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a visitor. Archer smiles to himself -- pleased at Brodie's timeliness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer's boots lock down -- as the guillotine door rises. But his confidence evaporates into unspeakable horror.   Because he finds himself staring into the blue eyes of -- Jon Archer.  This man has Archer's face -- his real face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?  Don't you like the new me? Archer studies the image of his former self -- trying to understand.  Then he recognizes the smirk on the face,  the mocking twinkle in the eyes and he says what he  cannot say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Castor...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be.  It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the phrase Dr. Hoag used was 'titanically remote'.  Who knows?  Maybe the trauma of having my face cut off pulled me out.  Or maybe God really is on my side after all. (starts pacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I know you don't get the papers in here. Continuing to circle, he displays the current LA Times: "INFERNO AT HOAG INSTITUTE -- Malcolm Hoag Dead"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible tragedy. Hoag was such a genius -- but selfish with his artistry.  I actually had to torture his assistants to convince him to perform the same surgery on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I killed them, you dumb fuck.  Hoag, his staff... FLASH ON Hoag's body -- on the floor of the burning lab. Two more burned bodies adjoin Hoag's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller and Brodie -- FLASH ON Brodie and Miller -- dead in a mangled car wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I even paid a visit to your buddy Tito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know anything about this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jon.  I think I know you better than that.  I only wish you could have been there to see the look on his face -- FLASH ON Tito... he smiles, then recoils in shock as Castor lifts a pistol and shoots him... then he picks up Archer's wedding band off the counter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer stares -- thunderstruck -- at the wedding band now on Castor's finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- then again, I guess you were there. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I torched every shred of evidence that proves who you are.  So swallow this -- you are going to be in here for the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor, don't do this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No discussion, Jon -- no deals. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got an important government job to abuse, and a beautiful wife to fuck.  Excuse me -- I mean 'make love to.' Archer freaks out.  He screams, flails -- unable to reach Castor.  Castor opens the door and guards rush in -- clubbing Archer and shocking him senseless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quite all right.  You never know what to expect from a psychopathic criminal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards dump Archer into his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better be nice, Castor.  You could get mighty lonely now that Pollux is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pollux is -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer cut him a deal for turning state's evidence.  He's been released...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walton, you have to listen to me -- right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what?  You'll have me fired? (pushes a button)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're confined until I say otherwise... The steel panels shut - silencing Archer's pleading voice.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Sipping a beer, Castor cruises past the suburban bliss: men on hammocks; women chatting; kids playing tag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sickened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what a life. Castor tries to catch a street address and rolls past...

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: Dressed for work, Eve watches blandly as the car goes by. A moment later, it backs up and parks. Hiding the beer can, Castor forces a sheepish smile -- and gets out.  She doesn't smile back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose it was only a matter of time before you forgot where we lived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry -- the job's been murder lately. Castor looks her over -- she's much sexier than he  expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened to your 'important' assignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know exactly what you always tell me:  Absolutely nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't work out the way everyone thought it would.  Where are you off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surgery -- are you okay? Then he spots her medical bag.  Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to charm me -- I'm still angry.  There're leftovers in the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have fun at work. Castor kisses her good-bye -- on the mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I usually kiss my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Castor reacts as she gets in the car and pulls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor steps inside, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a dump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor sifts through Christmas cards from holidays past, studying the ones with photos.  He's memorizing --  matching names to faces -- Wanda's, Buzz's, Lazarro's,  etc. Something else catches his eye.  He finds a floral notebook -- Eve's diary -- and pages through it.  Then, he reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '... "Date-night" has been a typical failure... we haven't made love in almost two months...' What a loser ... Castor hears a voice.  Glancing across the hall, he sees...

dialogues.speaker: GLIMPSES OF JAMIE
dialogues.text: As she walks back and forth in her room, talking on the phone -- and wearing only panties and a cropped T-shirt. Castor steps closer -- enjoying the view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plot thickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie stamps out her cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I got your E-mail, Karl.  That poem was really sweet -- (spots Castor at door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on a sec... She slams it -- but he gets his foot inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you back. (to Castor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not respecting my boundaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming in, Janie. Castor pushes menacingly into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Janie'? Castor spots her correct name embroidered on a pillow.   He gazes seductively -- unnerving Jamie as he steps  toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you heard me... Jamie... You have something I want ... He reaches for her -- and right past her.  He picks up a pack of cigarettes from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarissa left those here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs and lights up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't tell mom if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be seeing a lot of changes around here -- (blows a perfect smoke ring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's a new man. Jamie stares, astonished, as Castor goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fists bloody, voice hoarse, Archer pounds at the cell door.  Exhausted, he finally stops -- staring at the face of his enemy in the mirrored door -- the enemy who now has total command of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor dons his stern "Archer" face as the gate guard checks his thumbprint ID.  He's cleared and waved in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz and Wanda watch Pollux through the two-way mirror. He's gorging himself on a big lunch.  Castor arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, sir... we just want you to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all really sorry about Tito...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, shit happens. Buzz and Wanda exchange a glance.  To them, "Archer" is just avoiding his feelings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's our star witness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't told us a damn thing except what kind of mustard he likes on his tongue sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that bomb is out there -- we're almost out of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer! Lazarro stomps toward them... furious.  Buzz and Wanda quickly excuse themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a deal with Pollux Troy? He's 'a manipulative psychopath.' Your own words, Jon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me do my job, Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The job I've been protecting for the last eight years.  From now on, you go strictly by the book. Everything gets cleared by me. Understand? Lazarro stomps off.  Castor watches him go, wheels turning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor enters -- shutting down the mikes... and the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be snitching -- making me look good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Look good'? (drops food in disgust)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing that face -- I want to vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one who has to look at this butt-ugly mug every time I pass a mirror.  Look at my eyes, my chin, my perfect nose -- gone! (considers his reflection)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer took my life, so I'm taking his.  Bro, I'm going straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like they took your brain, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine Dillinger as J. Edgar Hoover.  Carlos the Jackal running Interpol.  Kaddafi heading the Mossad.  Think of the secrets we could sell... Pollux listens carefully -- mind clicking like an abacus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drug agents we could expose. The movie stars we could blackmail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just the bottom of the food chain.  Pollux -- what would happen if somebody planted a bomb on Air Force One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... that somebody would get rich. And, I suppose, the nation would be pretty pissed-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pissed-off, vulnerable... looking for someone to step in, take charge, give them hope again. What if that someone was an F.B.I. hero?  A true Boy Scout and family man -- with a spotless past. Imagine where that guy could land -- if the timing's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an audacious dream, Caz.  But Jon Archer is hardly a household name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet he isn't.  But after you 'confess' -- you'll be a free man. And I'll be on my way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police VEHICLES ROAR into position.  Squads of police evacuate throngs of people.

dialogues.speaker: BOMB TIMER
dialogues.text: TICKS down to less than two minutes. Working as a unit, the BOMB SQUAD carefully remove the bomb's casing.  Inside, the complex guts glow evilly. The men are tense, cautious -- and way out of their  league.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... Any suggestions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... run Castor pushes up his blast visor.  He looks grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's protected by a vibration detector... One touch and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evacuate your team, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you can't disarm it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go! The bomb squad hustles out.  Waiting until he's alone, Castor pulls a radio device from his pocket and hits its switch.  The bomb's glow dies instantly.

dialogues.speaker: TIMER
dialogues.text: stops at 26 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Not satisfied, Castor starts it up again -- running the timer down to four seconds.  That's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The inmates eat lunch.  Walton enters -- prodding a beaten Jon Archer ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A special privilege today:  TV -- by order of Agent Jon Archer of the F.B.I... Jeers from the inmates as the big screen changes from the nature loop to... CNN.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: "Sweating," Castor lumbers out, carrying the disarmed bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the scene at the L.A. Convention Center, where an F.B.I. agent is being hailed as a hero. Agent Jon Archer disarmed a powerful bomb just seconds before it was set to explode.  Let's get the latest from Valerie Rice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor basks in the attention of the gathered media.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The apparent target was a group of Supreme Court justices -- due to speak here today. (thrusting microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Archer, do you have any idea who planted it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's classified.  But if he's listening I have a message for him: (directly into camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try.  Now you know who's really in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the TV, Archer's enraged, frustrated.  Then his  eyes focus... he watches closely as -- A guard uses his "thumbprint ID" to get through the  security door.  Archer's eyes fall on the thumbprint scan pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor gets a "thumbs up" from some co-workers, others smile -- but they know better than to applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you guys watch TV?  Where's the parade? They look at each other -- afraid.  But proud rookie  Loomis starts clapping, so everyone else joins in rousing applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Loomis, Buzz, uh -- Wanda... all of you, thanks from the bottom of my heart.  Thanks for enduring all those years I was an insufferable boor.  From now on -- consider me reborn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the presses -- Jon Archer found a personality... Wild applause... interrupted by an excited Kim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir... the White House is calling. Castor acts startled... as if at a loss.  Then he struts toward his office -- pausing only to give Kim a playful swat on the rump.  She's stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor surveys his new domain.  He settles into Archer's big leather chair... sees a framed photo of Archer and family.  He apes Archer's dumb posed smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, your career is finally taking of. (picks up phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer.  Sure I'll hold... Waiting, he picks up a handbook:  You and the FBI:  A Primer for New Employees.  Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, what an honor... Castor pumps a "whacking off" gesture with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor, carrying grocery bags, comes into the back yard  where Jamie practices free throws.  He watches her miss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a game of horse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me beat your butt again, Dad.  It's harmful to my developing psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid you'll lose? Castor crisply sinks a free-throw.  Jamie glares, takes the ball -- and tosses an air-ball.

dialogues.speaker: 'H.'
dialogues.text: Jamie sneers at him.  He buries another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try putting a higher arc on the ball... and square your shoulders to the basket. Begrudgingly, she listens -- and sinks a clean shot. Pleased, she nods.  HONK!  A BMW pulls into the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go.  Karl's here. Jamie trots over to greet KARL (17) -- a clean-cut preppie.  Opening the car door dor her, Karl waves, smiling at Castor.  Castor studies Karl carefully, not liking what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tired Eve opens the door.  It's pitch black inside.  As she fumbles for the light switch...

dialogues.speaker: MATCH
dialogues.text: flares as Castor lights a candle.  The dining room table is set for a candlelight dinner.  He smiles warmly at her confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you forgot.  Eve -- it's date night!

dialogues.speaker: DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: Eve looks up from her pasta.  After an awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I feel like I'm on a blind date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's important to keep some mystery... so things stay... unpredictable. Eve studies him as he pours her more wine.  Her smile slowly fades as she realizes what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Unpredictable'?  You're about as unpredictable as the tide. (detached)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
