dialogues.text: How long are you going to be gone this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what all this is about? The wine, cooking me dinner -- your next assignment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always say that -- then you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet I deserved that.  I bet Jon Archer is the most inattentive, sexless spouse on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, that's not true --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's true, but I'm trying to change?  I'm here because I want to be alone with you.  I want to see the candle- light dance in your beautiful -- Uh-oh.  Castor can't tell the color of Eve's eyes.  He  leans in "romantically" -- but we know the real reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- brown eyes. He smells her hair, then her shoulders, her skin.  She's aroused, but wary.  So Castor goes in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted it all to be just right... when I told you about my promotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't have it yet.  But Lazarro's getting old -- he won't be around forever.  And I'm getting the itch to move up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon... that's wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you see, I'm not going anywhere.  Unless it's upstairs with you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor carries Eve into the shower and spins on the  water. He rips her blouse open -- on her like a vulture to  carrion.  As they drop to the floor of the stall -- water filling up around them -- Castor licks her ear and whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: baby, it's like I'm having you for the first time. Dirty water runs down a floor drain... PULL BACK to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desolate, Archer mops down the rec area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't they ever let us take off these boots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not unless you're sent to the 'Clinic.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean if I get sick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't give two fucks about your health.  The Clinic's where they send the real hard-cases for attitude adjustment.  Dubov just got sent down -- and look at Wainwright -- Voisine gestures to a dazed inmate nearby -- WAINWRIGHT -- who sits in a corner -- gnawing at his knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toughest bastard I ever saw -- after you, of course.  Now he's a fucking drool case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hit a guard. Archer sees Walton hovering nearby.  Archer heads for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for trouble, Castor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact -- yes. Crack!  Archer decks Walton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walton and a guard herd Archer toward a steel door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer is dumped on the floor.  He sees he's lying in a puddle of something.  He looks up -- and recoils.

dialogues.speaker: DUBOV
dialogues.text: is strapped to a vertical gurney -- post-procedure.  His  limbs are stiff, his eyes blank as a mako shark's.  But  his feet are bare -- bootless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the mop, he puked all over the place. An assistant unstraps Dubov and drops him on a gurney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mopping up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- next time, bring them in before dinner... Archer cases the place:  Above is a catwalk... leading out.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Walton muscles Archer into the gurney.  The Med-Tech  smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh happy day -- Castor Troy. The Med-Tech wheels the ECT head-gear cart into place:  twin needle-like BOLTS ready to fit into ARCHER'S ears.   A single blue static spark jumps from the bolts. Walton roughly wedges Archer's head into the head gear, shoving the chewed-up bite strap into Archer's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bite hard, scumbag, 'cause you'll be gumming baby food from here on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get his boots, Sergeant. Walton unlocks Archer's first boot and pulls it off.  As the Med-Tech starts to fasten Archer's arm -- Walton  unlocks and pulls off the second boot. Archer's feet are free.  Crack!  He yanks his foot up  hard -- Walton reels back, stunned. One arm still restrained, Archer backrolls in the gurney  and kicks the head-gear cart away -- knocking it into the Med-Tech who collapses onto it, hitting "Test" -- ZAP!  The HEAD-BOLTS FIRE, catching the Med-Tech through  the shoulder -- he drops to the floor, his synapses shot. Seeing that Archer is still restrained by the arm -- the assistant darts out of the room. As Archer pulls free -- Walton looms over him -- gun poised. Then -- wham!  Dubov wallops Walton -- using his boots as brass knuckles.  The head guard collapses. Dubov smiles dumbly at Archer -- all trace of vendetta now obliterated.  Archer nods gratefully -- they're on the same team... at least for now. Suddenly the ALARM BLARES. Archer sees guards charging the room.  He tries closing the door -- but the guards arrive.  Dubov lumbers over and puts his massive weight into it -- and slams the door shut. O.S., guards POUND at the now-locked door. Archer quickly frisks Walton -- coming up with a cigarette lighter.  he pockets it. Scanning around -- Archer leaps onto a mounted, hinged lamp.  it swings against the wall.  Archer uses it to reach the catwalk above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dubov -- come on! Dubov obeys and follows Archer up onto the catwalk. A groggy Walton muscles open the door from inside.   Guards pour in.  Walton grabs an AUTO-RIFLE and opens  FIRE. SLUGS chase Archer and Dubov as they flee through the catwalk door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two guards watch Archer and Dubov disappear off the clinic's monitor.  They grab their shock-sticks and rush for the door. The door opens -- revealing Dubov and Archer.  Perfectly in synch -- they double cold-cock the startled guards. Archer grabs a shock-stick -- and fuses the door shut. He yanks out wires and shatters the computers.  Dubov mimics the behavior -- ripping out an entire console -- and revealing a narrow cable duct. Flames explode -- shorting the circuitry -- the DRONING HUM RISES -- the magnetic power monitor shows a dangerous surge.

dialogues.speaker: AROUND PRISON
dialogues.text: Chaos.  Guards scatter as the huge diamond-vision SCREEN EXPLODES and inmates are flung like rag-dolls by their short-circuiting boots.  Anything metallic flies into the magnetic domes.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY CENTRAL
dialogues.text: As the men back through the cable duct -- Archer struggles to replace the heavy console. The DOOR is BLOWN open.  Walton enters to find... no one. Then his eyes light on the console -- slightly askew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer and Dubov rush down the tight corridor -- and around the bend.  The corridor ends in a...

dialogues.speaker: STORAGE/MAINTENANCE AREA
dialogues.text: Lined with tools, toilets, sinks, a rack of old lock-down boots.  They race through the far door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer and Dubov find themselves in a multi-level labyrinth.  A hundred feet high -- criss-crossed with catwalks, staircases and high walls. ECHOES resound -- SHOUTING, FOOTSTEPS GETTING CLOSER -- they seem to be coming from all around them. Over the magnetic HUM -- Archer notices loose screws and other metal debris stuck to the sheer wall.  He pulls one screw away -- and lets it fly back into the polarized wall. Archer gets an idea -- and looks back the way they came.

dialogues.speaker: SHEER WALL
dialogues.text: Archer and Dubov scale the face -- using the old metal boots.  They climb higher and higher as... Guards criss-cross the catwalks and staircases below and around them -- oblivious. Archer and Dubov almost reach the next level when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! BULLETS SMACK the wall around them -- just as Archer and Dubov reach the next catwalk. Archer spots the emergency exit security door at the far end.  But four guards descend on them -- and block their way. Fist fight as Archer and Dubov take on the attacking guards.  Archer heaves one down the stairs -- into more guards.  Dubov drops another over the catwalk. They continue their desperate race for the door -- reaching the landing.  As BULLETS PING around them -- hulking Dubov rips away a floor panel.  He uses it as a shield as Archer sparks up Walton's lighter. As SLUGS EXPLODE into the shield -- Archer places the flame to his thumb... and peels off the skin mold. He presses his thumb to the door's keypad.  To his  horror, its LED reads "print unreadable." Walton and guards movie in, FIRING at closer and closer range. Dubov staggers under the FUSILLADE OF BULLETS.  The shield is repeatedly punctured -- and is quickly disintegrating. Archer licks his thumb, tries again.  Finally it reads "Clearance Confirmed"... the door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Dubov heaves the shield at the encroaching guards -- but as he turns to follow... Walton BLOWS him away. Archer reaches to pull Dubov through, but the riddled inmate ignores the helping hand.  Pulling the door shut, he collapses in front of it -- blocking it momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer hesitates for a moment... but that's all he has. he keeps going... up the winding staircase-catwalk -- higher and higher -- a step ahead of the onrushing guards. As BULLETS CLANG around him -- Archer reaches the top. He ignores a sign which reads... EMERGENCY EXIT ONLY SAFETY LINES REQUIRED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He charges straight up a ladder and plows right through --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer's blinded -- it's daytime in the real world. A sea gull flies across his face -- as we FOLLOW the bird... PULL WAY, WAY BACK to reveal: The prison's in the middle of the goddamn ocean, in what appears to be just an abandoned, rusty oil rig platform. Archer rushes over to a transport chopper.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE COCKPIT
dialogues.text: Archer searches for the keys.  No go.  He throws switches.  Nothing works. Guards pour out of the hatch -- FIRING.  Archer leaps from the chopper and jumps over the side to the platform's --

dialogues.speaker: LOWER LEVEL
dialogues.text: He lands hard on the slanted, corrugated shed roof and rolls to the ground.  He grabs a high-pressure hose -- and cranks the pressure valve -- as the pursuing guards close in. Archer BLASTS the guards with the WATER CANNON -- knocking Walton and others into the sea.  Archer upends a stack of oil barrels -- which roll into more guards. Archer spots:

dialogues.speaker: TUGBOAT
dialogues.text: pulling a Zodiac dinghy -- heading out to sea. Archer jumps up a stack of pipes to the south rail -- where the end of a crane's hook is tagged back.  Under FIRE -- Archer frees the hook, which swings away from the platform. Hanging on to the hook, it swings him out over the ocean. At the apex -- le lets go and plummets down into...

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPY SEA
dialogues.text: He pulls himself into the ZODIAC and frees it from the tug.  It ROARS off.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The nylon craft zips through the waves -- approaching San Pedro Harbor.  The ENGINE SPUTTERS... low on gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... come on... Archer senses something... He looks up and... Whoosh!  Something swoops down -- but it's just a pelican. He FIDDLES with the ENGINE -- which finally DIES.  Archer grabs the oars -- about to start rowing when -- Another swoop!  This time it's the prison chopper. Archer spots a string of buoys dotting the harbor.  An idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper settles over the Zodiac. Wind and water swirl around Archer...

dialogues.speaker: CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Walton, drenched but obviously rescued, has archer in his sights... He starts to FIRE his MACHINE GUNS...

dialogues.speaker: ZODIAC
dialogues.text: BULLETS RAIN down on the boat -- destroying it -- as Archer dives into the rolling swells...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Walton RAKES the debris -- shredding it. The chopper does a final circle of the wreckage... then moves off... its ROTOR WASH THRASHING the buoy.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER BUOY
dialogues.text: Archer has crawled up into the hollow buoy -- sucking air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve's asleep.  Castor, dressed, looks down at her like  Cortez at Montezuma -- triumphant, with overwhelming  power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heading for the car, Castor is about to light up when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, I thought -- this isn't my husband. He pockets the smoke.  Eve is there, dressed somberly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I woke up in the middle of the night -- and found you passed out in the study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't sleep -- you roll around a lot. (jingles car keys)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, you know what day it is.  I know it's difficult for you, but we still have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we skip it just this once? I gotta 'protect and serve', you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Protect and serve' later.  You're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, if you insist.  But -- you drive. He climbs into the front seat beside her.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A pastoral, hilly area near the coast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's this Karl creep Jamie's been seeing?  He's a little old for her, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... they're about the same ages we were when we met. (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the all-night dentist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, how could I forget. (changes subject)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, you never said anything about last night... He moves closer, stroking her hair as his BEEPER sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to get that? He turns his beeper off, then touches her lips with his finger.  Without knowing exactly why, Eve tenses up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon -- this is hardly the time or place. Castor looks around in surprise because he sees she's  driving into --

dialogues.speaker: SPRAWLING MEMORIAL PARK
dialogues.text: They drive through the gates -- passing a church marked "ST. MARY'S-BY-THE-SEA."  Nearby, the OCEAN ROARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful here, striking and sad.  Now on foot, Castor follows Eve up a bluff, through a phalanx of  graves -- with no idea where she's leading him. Finally she stops at a crucifix-topped headstone.  Castor joins her and reads the etched marble stone: Matthew Archer, Age 5 Beloved Son & Brother We Cherish You Always

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned, Castor watches as Eve kneels beside the marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Matty. She places a few child's toys on the marker... a shark... a little bulldozer... a spaceship.  Overwhelmed with  grief, she collapses into Castor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took our baby, Jon.  He took our little boy.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: He stares at the grave of the boy he killed -- the boy  whose mother is weeping into his chest. The ever-present smirk is long gone as Castor stiffly  returns Eve's embrace -- maybe, just maybe, feeling the  victim's pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop crying... stop crying... stop ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking off his funk, Castor arrives at the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You picked a helluva day to leave your beeper off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somehow he escaped from Erewhon. But a prison chopper mowed him down just off Long Beach Harbor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the body?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hasn't been recovered yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'It hasn't been recovered yet!' You people have no idea who you're dealing with! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everyone on this, reports on the half hour, and all leads get routed through my office. Buzz, alert the L.A.P.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: L.A.P.D.?  Even if he is alive, Castor isn't stupid enough to come back to the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alive -- and he's already here.  Move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something bobs up in the surf.  Archer is thrashed ashore by the breakers... he crawls gasping onto the sand.  He takes a few breaths -- then staggers up onto the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer's heart sinks as he sees the yellow police cordon taped across Tito's front door.  Some teenage cholos notice him -- so Archer keeps right on going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rear window is forced open -- Archer pulls himself in. In the dim light, he sees the bullet hole on the wall... then the blood stains within the forensics chalk marks. He buckles and has to sit down.  Taking a deep breath, he picks up the phone and dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Archer please.   It's an emergency. (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Her husband. Archer waits.  He pinches his throat -- trying to  dislodge the vocal implant.  His voice scrambles into  garbled static.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Eve -- I know this sounds crazy, but -- (reverting back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVE deftly stitches up a gash above little IRIS's (8) eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did this happen, sweetie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fell off her Big-Wheel. Something about his too-quick response rankles Eve.  She eyes the yuppy Dad with suspicion -- then notes some bruises on the child's arm.  A NURSE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Archer -- your husband's on three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get Child Services down here -- and don't let her father leave. (goes to wall-phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon?  Hello? INTERCUT Archer and Eve as necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve, listen carefully.  The man you think is your husband -- isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, just listen!  Take Jamie and go to your mother's in Santa Fe.  Don't tell him where you're going -- just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever you are -- don't call again... CLICK.  Archer sags in futility.  A SIREN snaps him back to reality. Archer goes to the window and carefully peers out. A squad CAR ROARS INTO VIEW -- then continues on its way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak to Director Lazarro immediately... I have information about Castor Troy. Waiting... Archer rifles the room... finding car keys... a baggy jacket... Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jon Archer.  Who's calling? Archer pauses... hearing his own voice speaking to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you're Jon Archer... I guess this must be Castor Troy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gotta hand it to you, Jon. You're doing a damn respectable job of being me.  But let's face it, we both liked it better the way it was.  So before the cops blow your brains out -- why not tell me where you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were really me, you'd know -- no discussion, no deals. Archer hangs up == leaving Castor stewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The automatic door lifts -- revealing Tito's old Buick. The big V-8 RUMBLES as Archer pulls out.  He doesn't get far as... menacing CHOLOS block his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten bucks he's the guy who popped Tito! The Cholos surround the Buick.  Archer's cornered like an animal as the angry teens pound on the windows. Archer HITS the GAS -- scattering all except Cholo #1 who jumps on the hood.  Archer SLAMS the BRAKES -- sending the guy flying.  He lands hard, but is only shaken up. As Archer roars off, Cholo #1 pulls out his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9-1-1?  I want to report a stolen car and don't put me on hold!

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Archer drives on -- listening to KFWB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the escapee is considered extremely dangerous.  If you have any information concerning the whereabouts of Castor Troy... He SHUTS it OFF as he sees in the distance:

dialogues.speaker: HIS OWN HOME
dialogues.text: FBI and LAPD vehicles are parked in front.  No way he's getting near there. In his rearview mirror Archer spots a cop car approaching.  He quickly turns a corner as the cop slowly cruises by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jon... you have to think like Castor.  Where would he go...? Archer gets an idea.  But as he drives on -- the cop car backs up -- and reappears INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dietrich locks up his chic art gallery.  He gets in his  Lexus and drives out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Dietrich slows down to check out the forensics team swarming all over Tito's parked Buick.  Dietrich quickly averts his face as he spots... "Jon Archer" inspecting Tito's Buick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon Archer... some poor schmuck's in big trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- me. With surprising speed, Dietrich yanks a pistol from someplace and jerks around -- Archer -- hunkered down in the back seat -- stares into  the barrel of Dietrich's pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Castor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drive.  And punch up your cellular -- I need you to make some calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna get me busted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're already busted, Dietrich. It's just a matter of time before they pick you up. Dietrich snakes the car past the crime scene and speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, when you came to me about that bomb -- I knew I should have blown you off... but that's my fucking curse -- I just can't say no to a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't say no to money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my other curse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars pull up in front of a gentrified loft amid the low- rent streets. Emerging from them are several thugs -- including Aldo, Fitch and their sexy girl friends, LIVIA and Cindee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer splashes water on his face -- then stops and listens as the DOORBELL RINGS.  He screws up his courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Castor Troy... This is your old crew -- you don't take shit and you don't take no for an answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thugs admire the loft -- dominated by an enormous, in-progress mural and stunning glass-bricked floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva place, Dietrich.  So what's the big surprise? Archer emerges.  The men are stunned -- the women beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?  You're going to bring the Feds down on all of us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer doesn't want you, he wants me!  But I'm going to get him first -- with your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer's a damn celebrity now -- he's untouchable -- and you're radioactive. He turns to leave.  Archer wheels him around and smashes him into the wall.  Aldo goes for his gun, but Archer's too quick -- he strips him of it. The four bodyguards draw their weapons -- and surround Archer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna face-off with Castor Troy?  Come on, then!  Come on! 'Cause I've had a real bad day... Four against one -- and everyone's sweating but Archer. One-by-one, the bodyguards back off.  Archer points the gun at Aldo -- then smiles and hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all forgetting who the real enemy is. (to Aldo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months ago, Jon Archer hauled you in for questioning.  He rattled you so bad -- you shit your Armani suit right there in the interrogation room. Aldo blanches -- how did Castor know that?  Fitch laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You laugh, Fitch -- the way Archer laughed at your last arraignment, when you got down on your knees and tried to blow your way to freedom. Stunned, Fitch cringes as everybody cracks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all have a reason to hate Jon Archer.  We all want to see him dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And nobody's untouchable if we say he's not. The thugs exchange a glance... reading each other... considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all worked out.  Caz has Archer's routine down cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We start with your basic kidnapping.  Then -- a little surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surgery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to rearrange his face in a way you won't believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're an evil bitch, Caz.  But you've got balls of titanium. Count us in. Archer sighs with relief -- pleased with his performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- let's drink to it!

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: Dietrich cracks it open -- powder sifts into a big high- ball glass filled with mescal.  he hands it to Archer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about one of your famous toasts, Caz? They all look expectantly at Archer... he's at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To old jobs, new jobs and -- uh -- blow jobs? Silence -- then they crack up.  Reluctantly, Archer swallows the tumbler of mescal... he fights back the urge to puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough business, Caz.  Let's dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... I don't... She drags him onto the glass floor.  Cindee puts on some MUSIC as Archer's head begins to spin.  The girls start "dancing," grinding Archer between their taut bodies.  He tries to avoid it, but Livia kisses him -- hot, moist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the Charger's game, Caz? The owners box?  We did it four times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I remember... Once a quarter, right? Archer's eyes fall on the series of abstract paintings. The twisted renderings make his head spin worse... as he starts to hallucinate... surrounded by enemies -- he struggles to regain control of his battered psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz?  Are you okay? He pulls away and stumbles down the stairs -- toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When even Castor Troy can't handle a tab of Quantrex... (raises his glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, dear friends, is the first sorry whiff of old age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer has his mouth under the tap -- drinking greedily. Woozy, he takes a breath... and notices a reflection in the window above the sink.  Archer turns to see -- Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sasha Hassler.  Age 35.  Met Castor Troy in Austin, Texas, at Pearl Jam reunion... (catches himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, how you doing, baby? She responds by slapping him -- hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here? You're supposed to be dead... He wobbles, then falls flat on his face.  Out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor's chain-smoking, looking out over the city -- wondering where Archer might be hiding.  But something breaks his rumination.  He sees --

dialogues.speaker: DOWN STREET
dialogues.text: A BMW pulls up to the curb.  The THUMPING MUSIC from within GOES QUIET, but no one emerges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, Castor approaches the car, keeping a safe  distance.  He can see Jamie inside, struggling with Karl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Karl, please. He "shushes" Jamie -- but doesn't stop pawing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father -- he's got a gun -- he'll -- he'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls open belt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wimp won't do shit. SMASH!  The passenger WINDOW EXPLODES inward.  Castor drags Karl out by his hair.  Jamie scrambles out and flees toward the house as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you to call Jon Archer a wimp? Castor heaves Karl into the WINDSHIELD -- SPIDER-WEBBING  it.  Somehow the kid finds his feet and stumbles behind  the wheel.  The Beemer lurches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor enters to find Jamie, still shaken up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you -- stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just like you.  Some guy tries to rape me -- and you side with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it look like I was siding with him?  Did it? (she falls silent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to play with scummy organ grinders, you better be prepared. Do you have protection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like... condoms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean like... protection. With a fluid motion, Castor expertly SNAPS open a well- oiled SWITCHBLADE and hands it to an astonished Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time -- slip it in low, then twist it -- so the wound doesn't close. She hugs him tight -- taking Castor by surprise.  But he responds momentarily.  About to pat her rump -- something makes him stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, get out of here. Jamie kisses him and heads up stairs.  After she's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder he spent all his time chasing me.  Who can deal with this family shit? The PHONE RINGS.  He rushes to the den and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon Archer. (immediately alert)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using night-vision goggles, Pollux watches Sasha close her drapes.  Visible in the b.g. on the sofa -- is Archer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cell phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I thought he might visit some old friends of yours.  And bro, if I didn't know better -- I'd swear this guy likes being you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer wakens.  Sasha is tugging off his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh -- can't we just talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk?  The only talk I ever heard from you was 'take it off,' 'sit on it,' 'I'll pay you tomorrow.' She pulls out some fresh clothes -- and dumps them on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off the rest of those rags and get dressed.  Then get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until I finish my business with your brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him to keep those creeps away -- but you're just too big an attraction. (calming herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if the F.B.I. finds out you've been here -- I'll lose my son.  So please, just go. For the first time, Archer sees not a hardened felon -- but a frightened, protective mother.  And he realizes the effect his own relentless obsession has had on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I've done some things that made your life harder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would you?  You walked out and never looked back. ADAM enters, heading for his toys -- his presence cooling Sasha's deep-seated anger.  Archer finishes dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the same person you remember.  And for what it's worth, I'm sorry... Her harsh look softens imperceptively -- like that of a woman trying to hate someone she still loves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a bad fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They should.  They're yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice-looking kid, too

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he is... Sasha fidgets, struggling with a deep inner turmoil. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam, come here... I want you to meet your father. Archer's face pales over in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their silhouettes are visible against the shades. PULL BACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor, Buzz, Wanda and Loomis peer at the silhouettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into cellular)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got him sighted.  Okay, Pollux, pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure this guy's gonna set up his own brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been more certain of anything.  Get everyone in position.  Remember -- shoot to kill. Before Buzz can object, Castor's eyes say "don't argue."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the man -- let's saddle up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing with his toys, Adam does not see Archer's icy gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.  No one knows you're his father.  I thought someone might want to hurt him -- just to hurt you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang!  Bang!  Bang! Startled, they turn to see Adam pointing a toy gun at them.  Upset, she takes it from his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Mommy doesn't like you playing with these things... She kicks the toy aside and lifts Adam -- offering him to Archer.  Awkwardly, Archer takes the boy. Archer's emotions avalanche as his grip tightens -- his big hands dwarfing the little boy's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not holding him right... Caz... Archer isn't hearing Sasha.  He's lost in his own memory... the sound of a CAROUSEL... a KID'S LAUGHTER... a GUNSHOT... Then Adam smiles -- perhaps the way Matthew once smiled. It pulls something up from inside Archer -- something  strong.  He regains control, dumping the child into  Sasha's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he is -- ! Then something alerts Archer -- maybe the fleeting  shadows that blot out the window-light for the barest  second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down! K-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM!  The WINDOW PANES SHATTER -- as  TEARGAS GRENADES and GUNFIRE riddles the loft.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: across the way, Castor directs the FIREPOWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos.  A bodyguard is mowed down.  Dietrich and the others scatter and hit the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Cindee and Fitch are caught in flagrante delicto on the floor as the kitchen is decimated by GUNFIRE...

dialogues.speaker: SASHA'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Coughing, Archer crawls through the roiling smoke toward  the door.  He's almost out when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam! Her wail of fear freezes Archer.  He looks back -- and sees Adam in the eye of the firestorm. Archer's face betrays his conflict.  A child -- but his worst enemy's child. BULLETS SHRED the WALL around Adam.  Getting closer. Archer moves -- he crawls toward Adam. Just then -- a SWAT agent rappels in through one of the shattered windows, his weapon poised.  Archer kicks him hard, pitching him back through the window. Archer grabs Adam -- curling him into his body.  Thinking fast, he soaks his discarded T-shirt into a toppled flower vase -- then places it over Adam's face. Protecting him. He rushes to Sasha.  Together, they barrel through the soft, paper wall and tear out an escape route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRING out the window, Fitch is riddled from outside by an agent as he CRASHES through the WINDOW. Cindee slashes the agent with a cleaver.  He FIRES -- BLASTING Cindee into the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER LEVEL
dialogues.text: Archer hustles Sasha and Adam toward the staircase when --

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: explodes open.  SWAT agents swarm to get in -- FIRING and throwing FLASH-GRENADES.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER, SASHA AND ADAM
dialogues.text: are caught out in the open, when --

dialogues.speaker: UPPER LEVEL
dialogues.text: Dietrich, et al, open FIRE down on the attacking agents. Agents drop or are driven back out.

dialogues.speaker: SKYLIGHT
dialogues.text: BURSTS open and agents rappel down -- FIRING.  Aldo's bodyguard falls, riddled, off the upper level.

dialogues.speaker: LOWER LEVEL
dialogues.text: as one agent lands, Archer knocks his gun to the floor. They grapple.  As the agent reaches for it -- Adam appears and kicks the gun away.  Just like Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: scoops up the kicked weapon -- and cold-cocks another rappelling agent.  Then she FIRES, cutting a third rappelling agent's rope.  he drops hard to the floor -- unconscious. Still grappling, Archer rips off the agent's gas-mask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzz... Buzz's eyes reveal only hatred.  He reaches for his knife.  Archer hesitates, then heaves Buzz through the  glass door.  He pushes Adam upstairs as more agents pour in the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dietrich!  The painting!

dialogues.speaker: UPPER LEVEL
dialogues.text: Dietrich sees the canvas mural above the breached front door -- and understands.  He opens FIRE, cutting loose the mural.  It collapses, billowing -- and enshrouds the attacking agents -- and buying time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! Archer and Sasha flee up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER LEVEL
dialogues.text: Sasha sees Adam huddled in the middle of the glass floor -- the shadows of agents moving below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam!

dialogues.speaker: LOWER LEVEL
dialogues.text: An agent aims his shotgun at the glass floor -- at the "target" kneeling on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: UPPER LEVEL
dialogues.text: Archer dives and grabs the boy as the GLASS FLOOR EXPLODES up.  He rolls through a shower of glass -- but comes up with Adam safely. Agents and thugs FIRE blindly upward and downward through the floor -- desperate to hit their targets. Agents open FIRE from the girders supporting the roof -- cutting down Fitch's last bodyguard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like cockroaches! Dietrich and Livia toss SMOKE GRENADES into the loft -- covering their escape.

dialogues.speaker: TOP LEVEL
dialogues.text: Dietrich leads them to the very back of the loft.  He pulls open a hidden door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we make it, we'll meet up at my Malibu place.  You remember it, Caz?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Kanan Road -- I know it. Archer hands Adam over to Sasha.  She hugs her little boy -- then embraces Archer tightly.  Hanging on -- near tears -- because she knows this may be the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Caz... thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the boy out of here... Livia and the remaining bodyguard hustle Archer out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC-10 poised, Livia and the bodyguard rush Archer through the deserted rotunda -- BOOM!  BOOM!  His escorts drop. Castor rushes down the staircase -- BLASTING at Archer. Unarmed, Archer instantly disappears behind one of the eight columns.  The columns are separated by mirrored- panels. Cat-and-mouse as Castor slips in and out between column and mirror.  He spots Archer dead-ahead and BLASTS away! CRASH!  The MIRROR SHATTERS into a thousand pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's about a thousand years bad luck... Castor whirls, spots Archer again and FIRES!  Another MIRROR.  Sensing Archer behind him -- Castor turns and FIRES again -- this time BLASTING away his OWN REFLECTION. Then Archer leaps through a shattered mirror frame -- and onto Castor.  They battle for control of the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late, Jon.  Your kid loves me.  And your wife's an animal.  Even I can't keep up with her. They're so close Castor's whispering right in Archer's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight I'm going to make her come like Niagara Falls -- to celebrate your death. Castor licks Archer's ear salaciously.  Enraged, Archer tears the pistol from his grip and turns it on Castor. He's got Castor dead to rights -- suddenly BULLETS SHRED the world around him.  Archer staggers away as -- Loomis enters -- FIRING his M-16 as Archer dives for a doorway.  Loomis FIRES the M-16's grenade launcher. BOOM!  The GRENADE EXPLODES -- the doorway bursts into flames -- but Archer has made it through. Loomis tries to help up Castor -- who pushes him off angrily.  Castor can't follow through the flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer slams out of the interior stairwell -- but BULLETS force him to take cover behind the cupola. Pollux FIRES at him from the other side. Archer RETURNS FIRE -- driving Pollux back.  Stand-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember me?  Your 'baby brother'? Trying to get the drop, Pollux carefully crawls onto the top of the cupola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tricked me into telling you things I never told anyone... Archer hears movement above him as Pollux reaches the crown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now take it to your grave. Archer FIRES his PISTOL -- into the glass cupola -- and SHATTERS the GLASS beneath Pollux's feet.  The cupola disintegrates beneath his weight.  He plunges down into --

dialogues.speaker: ROTUNDA
dialogues.text: Castor watches in horror as Pollux pancakes onto the floor at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pollux... Pollux is almost gone.  Castor looks up and sees --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: Peering down into the rotunda.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: Ducks the bullets as he disappears. Castor desperately holds Pollux -- to no avail.  Pollux slips away... and dies.  He turns to Loomis...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a medic -- now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget him, sir.  It's only Pollux Troy... Castor snaps.  Without hesitation, he jerks up his GUN and PUTS a BULLET right in the middle of Loomis's forehead. Castor looks at the dead kid -- his rage barely abated as -- Buzz and Wanda arrive on the scene and see Loomis's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you think happened?  Castor Troy just shot him! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?  Go! After Buzz and Wanda take off -- Castor gathers Pollux up in his arms -- totally devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dazed, Castor approaches his office.  Kim proudly holds a copy of Time magazine.  His photo is on the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir -- you're on the cover of Time.  They're calling you 'An Authentic American Hero.' He just pushes by her and goes into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone -- Castor picks up the framed photo of Eve and Jamie -- staring at it with unbridled hatred. Fury rising, he crumples the frame -- and the photo -- in his clenching grip.  He hurls it into other Archer family memorabilia -- shattering more photos and souvenirs. Only then does Castor notice Lazarro standing in the doorway.  For how long -- he can't be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Lazarro shuts the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were friends once, Jon, so I feel I owe it to you -- to tell you face-to-face... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care how much hype you're getting -- you're through.  After that massacre last night, I'm ordering a full inquiry into your recent erratic -- and deeply suspect -- behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me -- 'erratic'?  Victor, what are you talking about? Castor casually closes the blinds between the offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You start meeting with Brodie and Miller.  Then they die mysteriously.  Your best friend is murdered -- and you don't seem to give a shit. Suddenly you're smoking, drinking, acting like a man with something to hide... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you've been bought -- maybe you've lost your mind.  But I promise... I'm going to find out. Eye to eye... Castor knows he can't finesse this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Vic, I have a confession to make.  But you aren't gonna like it... (wraps arm around neck)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Castor Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I don't understand... Castor suddenly jabs his fist into Lazarro's chest.  He pleads for mercy as Castor pounds and pounds away at his heart -- until it finally seizes up. Lazarro twitches in a death throe, then slumps to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you understand. He punches up the intercom button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cancel my four o'clock. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And send for the paramedics. Victor Lazarro's having a heart attack. Castor fixes himself a shot of mescal.  He checks his watch -- as if counting -- then kneels beside Lazarro's body. The door flies open -- and two medics rush in.  They see Castor vigorously pumping Lazarro's chest -- "applying" CPR. The medics gently nudge Castor aside.  One medic takes Lazarro's pulse, then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor peers down over the city... trying to collect himself.  He lights up a smoke... planning his next move. His meditation is broken as a police chopper circles above.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: LAPD choppers circle... squad cars prowl... cops and FBI agents set up roadblocks.  The city is being sealed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skirting a roadblock, Archer appears to be coming undone... wobbly, wild-eyed... he suddenly picks up a trash can and carries it down the street in front of his face. Pedestrians gawk at this madman.  What's he doing? Archer finally stops in front of a sporting goods store. He swings the trash can.  SMASH!  The store's WINDOW SHATTERS.  An ALARM BLARES. Passersby stare at Archer for a moment -- stunned.  Then several youths leap into the window and start pulling merchandise out of the store. Mayhem as others join in... clerks rush out to do battle. An LAPD squad car hauls up onto the curb.  A cop leaps out and chases as the looters scatter. The driver stands at his door, radio in hand.  Sensing something, he turns... just as Archer grabs the canister of Comply-Gas from the cop's belt. Archer sprays him in the face.  The cop gags and sags. Archer quickly slips behind the wheel. Inside:  Archer hits a switch -- the car's tinted windows darken automatically, obscuring him from the outside.  He HITS the GAS -- SCREAMING away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer slows the squad car. Up ahead:  Parked cop cars block both lanes of the main  road -- a roadblock checkpoint for all traffic. Archer pulls off the road, out of sight.  He flips open  the portacomp and starts to type rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DISPATCHER'S SCANNER CLICKS to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units.  I have a confirmed code zero-zero priority alert. Proceed at once to Parthenia Street Terminal.  That's Parthenia at Nordhoff.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: Tac squads pile into armored Jeeps.

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: Choppers lift off and veer east.

dialogues.speaker: C
dialogues.text: The surveillance CARS ROAR away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer watches as the checkpoint of cop cars pulls apart  and screams east on the main road -- passing Archer.   Once the armada is gone, he pulls out and heads west.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plank in the fence swings aside as Archer slips into the yard.  He peers out from behind the garage. A cop sits in a lawn chair, tuning a POLICE-BAND RADIO. Archer approaches the bird feeder.  Quietly, he sticks his hand inside -- and searches for the key. Just when he grabs it -- CAW-CAW -- an annoying BLUEBIRD hovers over Archer.  The cop looks over -- but Archer is gone.  All Lars sees is the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor arrives.  Wanda is shocked to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where should I be? (looks around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's everyone else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backing you up!  Didn't you track Castor to the Parthenia Street Terminal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You radioed in your personal security code.  Nobody knows that code but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obviously someone else knows it! Get everybody back to their posts -- now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer tiptoes through the house -- listening.  He sees Cop #2 sitting at the dining room table, cleaning his pistol.  He slips upstairs -- toward the sound of RUNNING WATER.

dialogues.speaker: MASTER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Archer walks in and steps toward the bathroom -- passing  the bed.  He stops.  On top of the rumpled covers:  Eve's nightgown and a pair of Castor's black briefs. Overwhelmed, he sits down -- not noticing the water has stopped.  Eve steps in from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve... The look of horror on her face snaps him back to reality. She runs, but Archer grabs her.  She struggles --  fighting and kicking him -- but somehow he keeps her  mouth covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to hurt you.  Just don't scream, okay? (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay? Terrified -- she finally nods and he eases off her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you -- you're the one who called.  You're Castor Troy.  You killed my son --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I called, but I'm not Castor. I'm your husband. Archer holds onto her as she struggles again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you're going to listen.  The last time we saw each other -- was in this room.  We had a fight after I told you I had to go away. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My assignment -- Jon Archer's assignment -- was to enter a federal prison as Castor Troy. Eve is startled by this intimate information but she  reveals nothing.  SIRENS approach the house, the cops are returning.  She keeps an eye on the door.  Playing for  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he expect to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An F.B.I. surgeon gave me Castor's face.  He handled the transplant, the vocal implant, everything. But somehow Castor came out of his coma -- and killed everyone who knew about the mission.  But not before he was transformed into me. The back DOOR CLICKS open.  A voice booms out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Archer, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need hard evidence, get it. Your husband's blood type is O negative.  Castor's is A.B. Archer glances at the balcony -- as FOOTSTEPS CLOMP up  the stairs.  Eve is about to answer -- or scream.  But  then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the parachute dream?  I'm falling, Eve... I'm falling... The blood drains from her face as... Archer slips over  the balcony and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve is at the computer -- dazed and disoriented.  She snaps alert on hearing the front DOOR OPEN -- Castor is giving orders to the cops guarding the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you guys here around-the- clock.  And stay off the lawn. Eve feigns interest in her laptop as Castor enters.  She tenses as he starts massaging her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all in knots.  Maybe another date night will help you relax...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight... I'm way behind in my Continuing Ed. He studies Eve, then grasps her firmly by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I've been acting strange.  Like a completely different person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I have a confession to make. But you aren't going to like it... Castor wraps his hands around her slender neck... CASTOR (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I read your diary.  I've been trying to change -- trying to be more like the man you want me to be. Eve reacts to the explanation.  There is a logic to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to prove it, I'm taking you and Jamie away on a trip -- right after the memorial service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What memorial service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor Lazarro had a heart seizure... right in my office.  It was horrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God... Castor pours it on -- feigning immense grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First Tito... now Victor... (holds her tight)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... please don't tell me I'm going to lose you, too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (returns the embrace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor slumbers fitfully.  Suddenly, his shoulder twitches, rousing him.  He looks up to find Eve reading beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something bit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably a mosquito -- I'll close the window. Eve rubs Castor's shoulder blade until he falls asleep.   She gets up, closes the window, then goes into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve takes a breath, then produces a lancet from her pocket.  She squeezes the lancet -- and a drop of blood splashes into a glass vial -- Castor's blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eve gets the key in her car door -- a hand grabs her. She stifles a scream -- then sees... the two COPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Dr. Archer.  Where are you going at this hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been an emergency at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of us will have to escort you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But please don't wake my husband... he's exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happening here at 4 A.M.  Nothing indeed.  The bored Cop keeps watch outside -- as Eve hustles in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve paces anxiously as the BLOOD ANALYZER CLICKS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be O-neg.  Please... The MACHINE STOPS CLICKING.  It reads "Male -- Type AB." She buries her face in her hands -- completely stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for believing me. Archer emerges from the darkness of her office -- but Eve pulls a pistol -- aiming it with calm authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  Where did you get that gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took it from my fake husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why point it at me?  I'm the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know that.  Maybe Jon's already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What more proof do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me... tell me about the all- night dentist. As Archer speaks -- Eve searches his eyes for the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I took a date out for chicken and ribs -- not knowing she was a vegetarian.  When the night couldn't get worse, she broke her tooth on a pebble that got into her three-bean salad Somehow she and I had fun driving around looking for an all-night dentist... (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And even though it must have hurt -- you still kissed me. Eve slowly puts the gun down, fighting off tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Jon!  How could you put us in this position?  Do you know -- do you know what he did to me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened, whatever he did -- I know it's my fault and I know I can never make it up to you -- She pulls herself together -- regaining her composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're damn well going to try. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First -- how are we going to get you out of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor wakes up and finds Eve gone.  His eyes narrow as he touches the mosquito bite -- the one that isn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve sifts through the supply cabinet and finds a yellow vial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This will knock him out for hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  What's his schedule tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't tell me anymore than you ever did... All I know is -- tomorrow we're going to Victor's memorial service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor... Tito... they both died thinking I killed them... And in a way... I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon -- you can't think about that now. Archer takes a breath -- and pulls himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What happens after the memorial?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taking Jamie and me away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And neither of you will be coming back.  Where's the service?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Mary's-By-The-Sea. Archer reacts... the irony's not lost on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him with a trank dart.  Once he's unconscious -- I'll try to get to Buzz and Wanda before the security team gets to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think up a good excuse.  I don't want you or Jamie anywhere near that service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can cover for Jamie.  But if I'm not there, he'll suspect something... (as Archer considers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second you make your move, all hell's going to break loose.  If I'm there beside him -- I can take charge.  I'm his wife, remember? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way around it -- for once, you need me. Archer looks into her eyes -- the regrets flooding over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always needed you... They embrace... soaking up each other's warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon -- what are the odds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible.  But it's the best we can do with what we have. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it doesn't happen, take Jamie and don't look back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll happen. FOOTSTEPS APPROACH -- they break their embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do doctors travel in packs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when we're golfing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor and the twins round the bend -- just in time to see the door to the burn ward close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve quickly wraps gauze around a patient's head -- when Castor and his boys rush in, guns leveled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon!  What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you're going to explain to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't the police tell you?  There was an emergency. Lars starts pulling at the patient's bandages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon -- stop it!  Mr. Alandro is very ill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as ill as he's going to be... He blanches as Lars reveals a scarred burn victim -- Mr. Alandro.  Eve is livid as she attends to the patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  But what's a guy to think when his wife runs off in the middle of the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault.  I should've woken you up before I left. (kisses him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now please let me get back to work. They leave.  Eve wipes his ugly taste from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Castor gets into his car as he confabs with the twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here.  Watch her like a hawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think she knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?  She's going to be dead by tonight anyway.  They're all going to be dead.  The wife, the kid... and the father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archer waits as Sasha appears with a long case.  In the b.g., Adam plays on the Ranch House porch with Dietrich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ears are still ringing -- but he'll be okay. Archer opens the case.  Inside is a sniper rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck's all gassed up. Look, Caz, there'll be F.B.I. agents all over that place.  Maybe I can talk my brother into helping us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Us'?  No, Sasha -- believe me, this isn't your fight. He turns to leave -- but her look draws him back.  He kisses her -- not passionately, but nobly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks... She watches him as he walks off toward the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in staid black, Eve joins Castor at the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jamie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'd like to know.  She stole fifty dollars from my purse and took off. Castor's eyes narrow -- trying to read Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't act so stunned, Jon.  You know how hard it is to get that girl into a dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll deal with her later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Because I am fed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crucifix gleams in the sun... and anchoring the crucifix is... a headstone. Like so many others -- except this headstone is Matthew Archer's.  And hidden behind it is -- Jon Archer.  He finishes assembling the sniper rifle. For a moment he acknowledges Matthew's grave... the regrets giving way to determination.  He looks down from his vantage point onto --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the foot of the cemetery knoll.  Rows of chairs... white flowers... mourners.  A yacht is docked at the breakwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: peers down through scope -- seeing... Castor and Eve as they emerge from their limo. Eve glances around, searching for Archer.  She comes eye- to-eye with Lars -- who is watching her every move. Archer TRACKS Castor and Eve as they sit in the front row.  The ceremony begins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are here to celebrate the life of Victor Lazarro.  We all know him as a man who dedicated himself to defending this great nation -- first, as a highly decorated admiral -- then, as west coast director of the F.B.I.  But not all of you know what a deeply spiritual man he was.  It was his wish that his Requiem Mass be performed in Latin. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Nomine Patris, et Filii et Spiritus Sancti.  Amen... The PRIEST begins to recite a beautiful and somber mass.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: fills the trank-dart with sedative.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: continues the solemn ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domine, de morte aeterna, in die illa tremenda quando caeli movendi sunt et terra...

dialogues.speaker: EVE
dialogues.text: checks her watch... barely lifting her eyes away... Castor absently pats her knee.  She's forced to return focus to the service.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: chambers the dart, twists a knob on the range-finder, and carefully peers over the crucifix.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SCOPE
dialogues.text: Archer TRACKS THROUGH the mourners -- and FINDS Castor. As the cross-hairs neatly cube his head...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: We've come full circle from Matthew's death:  with Archer the sniper and Castor the target. The Priest's emotional reciting of the rites climaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Requiem aeternam dona eis, Domine... Amen.

dialogues.speaker: FULL SCREEN
dialogues.text: Archer's finger wraps around -- he starts to squeeze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crosses behind Castor, blocking Archer's shot.  Archer's finger freezes -- as the figure turns -- hair tumbling away from her face.  It's Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: AT SERVICE
dialogues.text: Eve stiffens as Jamie sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks anyway, Mom -- (slides her $50)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I wanted to be here for you... and Dad. Castor reads the panic on Eve's face, but says nothing. He simply takes Jamie's hand, intertwining his fingers in hers. The honor guard steps forward, shouldering their rifles, commencing their 21-GUN SALUTE as --

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: steadies himself, re-aims the sniper rifle. He hears MOTION behind him.  Someone's coming and fast... but this is his only chance.  Off-balance, Archer squeezes -- THFFFT!  The SILENCED TRANK-DART explodes from the barrel.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOW DART
dialogues.text: Screaming toward Castor's neck -- but it goes just wide. It sinks harmlessly into the grass -- unnoticed during the 21-GUN SALUTE.

dialogues.speaker: ON KNOLL
dialogues.text: THUMP!  Archer is cracked across the head.  He slumps down, unconscious, as a silenced gun barrel gently enters his ear.  As the saluting GUNS FIRE in the b.g. -- we don't know when, or if, this pistol fires...

dialogues.speaker: AT SEA-SIDE SERVICE
dialogues.text: The honor guard presents the urn to Mrs. Lazarro. Fearful, Eve chances a glance around -- wondering what's gone wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The admiral's family will now take his ashes to the sea... As Mrs. Lazarro and her grown children proceed to the docked yacht, Castor touches his ear-phone... getting a message. His eyes alight on a boathouse... adjacent to the service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into headset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lars -- take Jamie, bring the car around, then meet us at that boathouse... Guests head for their cars.  Eve seizes the moment and steps over to Wanda and Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda -- I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads her face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... what's wrong? But then Eve looks past Wanda -- and sees Lars looking at her -- tightening his "friendly" grip on Jamie's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby.  I've got a surprise for you. Wanda and Buzz watch as they head up toward the boathouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim, deserted.  Filled with boat parts, tools, etc. Castor hustles Eve inside and locks the door behind him. Lunt is there -- standing over a beaten Archer.  Eve gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who we caught creeping around -- Castor Troy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before I turn him in, I thought we'd pay him back for everything he's put us through... Castor starts kicking Archer.  Over and over in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, baby.  Join the fun -- Eve can't stand it.  She charges Castor -- but he immediately subdues her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad.  Part of me was hoping you didn't know. He throws her down beside Archer.  She clings to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really think it would be that easy, you dumb fucks? (to Eve)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, baby.  Castor Troy is about to murder you and our daughter... but I promise you won't die unavenged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is between you and me.  Leave them out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was between you and me.  Even your little boy -- that wasn't supposed to happen.  But you couldn't let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No father could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appealing to my sense of 'family' won't work, Jon.  I thought you knew me better than that Archer plays for time -- looking for some edge.  He sees a crate filled with block-and-tackle amid the shop's tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know some things that even you don't know, Caz.  You have a son. I've met him.  His name is Adam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine I've got a dozen kids -- so what? (cocks pistol)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more head games... First your wife dies.  Then your daughter. Then you. Castor smiles as the DOOR CREAKS open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one big happy family... But it's not Jamie and Lars.  Three people emerge from the shadows, machine pistols poised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dietrich -- Aldo -- Sasha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Archer.  Now drop 'em. No options.  Castor and Lunt drop their weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lars and Jamie pull up in the car.  Lars listens to his headset -- knows something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fucking move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha's at Archer's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caz -- are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making a mistake.  I'm Castor -- he's Archer.  Sasha, baby -- just give me a minute to explain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pathetic, Archer.  But then, your terrible sense of humor is legendary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocks GUN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pay-back time. Aldo aims at Castor when BOOM!  He's blown apart. Lars charges in -- BLASTING. Archer grabs a block-and-tackle as -- Lunt dives for Aldo's fallen machine-pistol.  Archer swings the block-and-tackle -- whacking Lunt across the head. Castor scoops up his pistol but Eve kicks him hard in the balls.  He doubles over. Archer snatches away the MACHINE PISTOL.  Staggered -- Lunt is quickly riddled by Dietrich. Castor and Lars BLAZE at the now-scattering intruders -- driving them back amid the shot's tools and drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Jamie! Eve crawls through the FUSILLADE toward the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Among the last to leave -- Buzz and Wanda snap alert. Over the CRASHING of the WAVES -- did Wanda hear something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve rushes to the car -- it's empty.  Jamie is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie?  Jamie! BULLETS SHRED the WINDOWS behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the GUN BATTLE -- we INTERCUT the deaths of Dietrich, Lars and Sasha WITH:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: being scattered at sea. Castor and Lars RIDDLE Sasha.  She drops.  Archer FIRES back -- killing Lars and driving Castor back. Archer leans beside the mortally-wounded Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Help Adam... don't let him end up like us... She dies in his arms.  Wounded, Dietrich crawls over. Seeing his sister, Dietrich rises in horror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha -- ! BOOM BOOM BOOM!  Castor wastes Dietrich.  Archer BLASTS back -- driving Castor outside.  Archer pursues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve runs smack into Wanda and Buzz -- they're on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We heard gunshots --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanda, I've got to tell you something.  Something crazy...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Archer emerges into the maze of dry-docked boats. Silently checking his clip, he discards the empty gun. Castor moves stealthily through the narrow paths. Hearing a NOISE behind him -- BOOM!  Castor FIRES -- blowing apart an under-repair hull.  He advances toward the boat, gun ready, when Archer appears behind him and follows -- one step, two steps -- until -- Castor stops -- then whirls as Archer leaps. The men collapse hard.  Castor's pistol clatters across the yard toward the docked boat. Archer and Castor brutally strangle each other -- digging their fingers deep into their throats.  They throttle each other so hard, Archer's larynx vocal chip is dislodged. His VOICE CHANGES, ECHOING with garbled.  STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up, Castor.  People are going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I kill you first. They scramble for the gun -- but a hand reaches out from the docked boat and picks it up.  Archer and Castor stop dead in their tracks because -- Jamie appears, holding the pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it here, Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jamie.  Don't do it! Everybody gawks -- because Archer and Castor are now... Both speaking in Archer's true voice. And nobody is more confused than Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to my voice, Jamie.  I'm your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trick, Jamie.  I'm your father. Jamie swings the gun back and forth -- baffled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him, Jamie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him! Jamie FIRES.  Archer reels -- as a slug grazes his shoulder.  Castor snatches the PISTOL from Jamie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dunce.  No kid of mine would miss so badly. He aims the gun at Archer's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. Wanda and Buzz have burst onto the terrace -- their guns leveled.  Eve and more agents are right behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just saving the taxpayers the cost of a trial.  So take a hike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both under arrest until a D.N.A. test proves who's who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ordering you to back off! Several agents waver -- unsure.  But not Wanda and Buzz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the gun down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't blame me for trying. He grabs a shocked Jamie -- shoving the gun under her chin. Archer struggles to his feet as -- Castor -- using Jamie as a shield -- backs out the gate to the garden.  Archer follows -- cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say goodbye to Daddy -- Jamie whips out the switchblade -- sinks it into Castor's thigh and twists.  She dives away.  FIRING wildly, Castor staggers back through the gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ungrateful delinquent!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE GATE
dialogues.text: As Castor turns and staggers away -- he runs smack into a confused security agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your weapon -- now! The agent hands over his UZI -- and Castor PLUGS him.

dialogues.speaker: BOATYARD
dialogues.text: Archer and Eve make sure Jamie's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Archer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?  Will someone please tell me what's going on? Archer rushes to the gate and hauls it open.

dialogues.speaker: CASTOR
dialogues.text: limps away from the boatyard, towards the slips -- alive with sunbathers and yachters.
